text2: Túrunamtai kuchin Wáinin pisarar péprunmasha shuarnumsha nuna etserarmiayi . Tuma asamtai iyutai tusar ashintiukarmiayi .

text: And they come to Jesus , and see him that was possessed with the devil , and had the legion , sitting , and clothed , and in his right mind : and they were afraid .
text2: Túrawar Jesusai jeawarmiayi . Jeawar aishman yaunchu iwianchrukun yamaikia pénker ajasun pushirin entsar pujan Wáinkiarmiayi . Wáinkiar ashamkarmiayi .

text: And they that saw it told them how it befell to him that was possessed with the devil , and also concerning the swine .
text2: Tura waketkiar kuchi Túrunamuncha iwianchruku pénker ajasmancha mash etserkarmiayi .

text: And they began to pray him to depart out of their coasts .
text2: Tuma asamtai ni nunkeya jiinki Wetá tusa seawarmiayi . Jesus kanunam enkemamtai aishman nuik iwianchruku amia nu Jesusan chicharuk

text: And when he was come into the ship , he that had been possessed with the devil prayed him that he might be with him .
text2: " Wi Amijiai tuke tsaninkian wekasatjai " Tímiayi .

text: Howbeit Jesus suffered him not , but saith unto him , Go home to thy friends , and tell them how great things the Lord hath done for thee , and hath had compassion on thee .
text2: Tura Núnaka Jesus suritkiamiayi . " Antsu ame jeemiin , áminiurmiin weme , Ashí Uunt Yus Túrutma nu tura waitnentrampra nusha ujakarta " Tímiayi .

text: And he departed , and began to publish in Decapolis how great things Jesus had done for him : and all men did marvel .
text2: Tutai aishmansha wémiayi . Tura antsu Tekapuris nunkanam Jesus niin pénker awajsamia nuna Ashí shuaran ujakmiayi . Nu nunkanmaya shuarka nuna antukar ti Enentáimprarmiayi .

text: And when Jesus was passed over again by ship unto the other side , much people gathered unto him : and he was nigh unto the sea .
text2: Ataksha Jesus kanujai katinmatai , aents Untsurí Niin irunturarmiayi . Jesuska antumianka Káanmatkari wajamiayi .

text: And , behold , there cometh one of the rulers of the synagogue , Jairus by name ; and when he saw him , he fell at his feet ,
text2: Tura Israer - shuar iruntai jea Náampruku , ni naari Jairu , Támiayi . Taa , Jesusan Wáiniak , piniakum tepersamiayi .

text: And besought him greatly , saying , My little daughter lieth at the point of death : I pray thee , come and lay thy hands on her , that she may be healed ; and she shall live .
text2: Piniakumar ti seak , " Winia nawantur jarutui . Winitiá , Túram pénker ajasat tusam uwejmijiai antintrukta . Nuinkia jarutkashtatui " Tímiayi .

text: And Jesus went with him ; and much people followed him , and thronged him .
text2: Tu Tímiatai Jesus niijiai wémiayi . Tura Untsurí shuar wena ásar Niin Chánuarmiayi .

text: And a certain woman , which had an issue of blood twelve years ,
text2: Nui pachitkia nuwa ti jaa wémiayi . Niisha tuse Uwí numpan ajapeak Wáitias pujuyayi .

text: And had suffered many things of many physicians , and had spent all that she had , and was nothing bettered , but rather grew worse ,
text2: Ti Untsurí tsuakratin nincha iisu armiayi . Tura iyamsha ti Wáitias pujuyayi . Tura ni Kuítrincha Ashí ajapaitiat Tsuámarchauyayi ; antsu tsuamsha nu arant ajauyayi .

text: When she had heard of Jesus , came in the press behind , and touched his garment .
text2: Nu nuwasha , Jesus Túramun antuku asa , ni ukuurini amainian ni pushirin antinmiayi .

text: For she said , If I may touch but his clothes , I shall be whole .
text2: " Wi aya ni pushirin antinnaka pénkerapi ajasaintjia " tu Enentáimiar Túramiayi .

text: And straightway the fountain of her blood was dried up ; and she felt in her body that she was healed of that plague .
text2: Tura Jesusa pushirin antin Nú chichamaik numpa ájapman menkakamiayi . Pénker ajasman ayashiin nekapramiayi .

text: And Jesus , immediately knowing in himself that virtue had gone out of him , turned him about in the press , and said , Who touched my clothes ?
text2: Tura nuin Jesuska , ni kakarmarijiai tsuarman nekapmampramiayi . Tura nuna Nekáa , ayantar chichaak " ṡYaki winia pushirun antintruka ? " Tímiayi .

text: And his disciples said unto him , Thou seest the multitude thronging thee , and sayest thou , Who touched me ?
text2: Tutai ni unuiniamuri tiarmiayi , " Untsurí Amin antinmainiasha ṡurukamtai " yaki winia antintkia " tame ? "

text: And he looked round about to see her that had done this thing .
text2: Tura Jesus , yaki Túruta tusa ashi iimpramiayi .

text: But the woman fearing and trembling , knowing what was done in her , came and fell down before him , and told him all the truth .
text2: Nuinkia nuwasha , ni ayashin Túruna nuna Nekáa , ti ashamak kuraimiayi . Tura Jesusan jeari tikishmatramiayi . Tura ni Túrunamurin Ashí paant ujakmiayi .

text: And he said unto her , Daughter , thy faith hath made thee whole ; go in peace , and be whole of thy plague .
text2: Takui Jesus niin chicharuk " Nawantru , Winia nekas Enentáimtursa asakmin , pénker awajtamsaitme . Shiir Wetá , tura tuke pénker pujusta " Tímiayi .

text: While he yet spake , there came from the ruler of the synagogue ' s house certain which said , Thy daughter is dead : why troublest thou the Master any further ?
text2: Tura Jesus nuna tuke chichas pujai , iruntai jea uuntri jeenia tariarmiayi . Tariar chicharainiak " Ame nawantrum jakayi . ṡUrukamtai Unuikiartin tuke itit awajsatam ? " tiarmiayi .

text: As soon as Jesus heard the word that was spoken , he saith unto the ruler of the synagogue , Be not afraid , only believe .
text2: Tura Jesuska , nii tiarmia nuna ántayat , Núnaka pachitsuk , iruntai jea uuntrin chicharuk " Ashamkaip ; áyatik nekas Enentáimtursata ' Tímiayi .

text: And he suffered no man to follow him , save Peter , and James , and John the brother of James .
text2: Tura Niijiai wétinian aya Pítruncha , Jakupuncha ni yachi Juanjai tsankatkarmiayi .

text: And he cometh to the house of the ruler of the synagogue , and seeth the tumult , and them that wept and wailed greatly .
text2: Iruntai jea uuntri jeen jeawar , aentsun charaatum ajainian , uutainian untsumuk ajainiancha Jesus Wáinkiamiayi .

text: And when he was come in , he saith unto them , Why make ye this ado , and weep ? the damsel is not dead , but sleepeth .
text2: Tura nuwach penké jakan nékayat , Wayá niin chicharuk " ṡUrukamtai Timiá uutrum , tura wa wa ajarum ? Nuwach Jákachai , antsu kanarai " Tímiayi .

text: And they laughed him to scorn . But when he had put them all out , he taketh the father and the mother of the damsel , and them that were with him , and entereth in where the damsel was lying .
text2: Nuna takui wishikrarmiayi . Tura Jesus Ashí jiir akupkarmiayi . Ayatik nuwachi Aparín , Nukuríncha tura Niijiai Táaruncha nuwachi tepamurin jukimiayi .

text: And he took the damsel by the hand , and said unto her , Talitha cumi ; which is , being interpreted , Damsel , I say unto thee , arise .
text2: Tura wayawar Jesuska nuwachi uwejen achik Tímiayi " Taritia kumi . " Nusha shuar chichamjainkia " Nawantrú Nantáktiá " tawai .

text: And straightway the damsel arose , and walked ; for she was of the age of twelve years . And they were astonished with a great astonishment .
text2: Nuwach tuse Uwí takakuya nu , Nú chichamaik nantaki wekasamiayi . Túramtai nui pujuarmiania nu ti Enentáimprarmiayi .

text: And he charged them straitly that no man should know it ; and commanded that something should be given her to eat .
text2: Jesuska chichaak " Atumsha penké etserkairap " Tímiayi . Tura " nuwach ayuratarum " Tímiayi .

text: And he went out from thence , and came into his own country ; and his disciples follow him .
text2: Jesus Nuyá jiinki ni nunken waketkimiayi . Ni unuiniamurisha nemariarmiayi .

text: And when the sabbath day was come , he began to teach in the synagogue : and many hearing him were astonished , saying , From whence hath this man these things ? and what wisdom is this which is given unto him , that even such mighty works are wrought by his hands ?
text2: Nuisha ayampratin tsawant jeamtai Israer - shuar iruntainiam Wayá unuiniamiayi . Tura Jesusan anturkarmiania nu ti Enentáimsarmiayi . " ṡJusha tui unuimiaruit . Ni nekaatniurincha yaki susait . Tura aentsti tujintiajnia nuna Niisha itiurak tura ?

text: Is not this the carpenter , the son of Mary , the brother of James , and Joses , and of Juda , and Simon ? and are not his sisters here with us ? And they were offended at him .
text2: Jusha Karpintíruchukait ; Maríi Uchirínchukait . Ni yachisha Jakupusha , Jusesha , Jútassha , Semunsha nékatsjik . Tura ni umaisha jui iijiai pujuiniatsuk " tiarmiayi . Túrawar Niin nekas Enentáimtustinian tujinkiarmiayi .

text: But Jesus said unto them , A prophet is not without honour , but in his own country , and among his own kin , and in his own house .
text2: Túrasha Jesus niin chicharuk " Yúsnan etserniun Chíkich nunkanmayanka shiir anturainiawai . Antsu Ní nunkeyanka , Ní shuarsha anturainiatsui " Tímiayi .

text: And he could there do no mighty work , save that he laid his hands upon a few sick folk , and healed them .
text2: Tura nuisha , ni nunkenkikia aentsti tujintiamun Túratniun tujinkiamiayi . Antsu jaancha aya ishichik ni uwejejai antin Tsuármiayi .

text: And he marvelled because of their unbelief . And he went round about the villages , teaching .
text2: Tura nekas Enentáimtacham " ṡurukamtai nusha ? " tu Enentáimsamiayi . Nuyasha Chíkich péprunam Wayá , Chíkich péprunam Wayá Yus - Chichaman Unuíniakní wekaimiayi .

text: And he called unto him the twelve , and began to send them forth by two and two ; and gave them power over unclean spirits ;
text2: Tuse unuiniamurin untsuk Jímiarchik Jímiarchik werum Yus - Chicham etserkatarum tusa akupkarmiayi . Tura iwianchin nupetkarat tusa ni kakarmarin Súsarmiayi .

text: And commanded them that they should take nothing for their journey , save a staff only ; no scrip , no bread , no money in their purse :
text2: Tura chicharuk " Jintiá Yurumátniusha jukiirap , uyuntrumiincha kuitcha enkearum jukiirap . Antsu aya aanik mashtun jukiirum wetarum .

text: But be shod with sandals ; and not put on two coats .
text2: Sapat uwekatarum , tura entsartincha Jímiar jukiirap , Tímiayi .

text: And he said unto them , In what place soever ye enter into an house , there abide till ye depart from that place .
text2: Tura jea wayarmena nuin pujustarum ; Pujá - pujakuarum Nuyá Chíkich peprunmasha wetarum .

text: And whosoever shall not receive you , nor hear you , when ye depart thence , shake off the dust under your feet for a testimony against them . Verily I say unto you , It shall be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment , than for that city .
text2: Tura Nánkamas aents atumin awaintiamainiachkuisha , anturtamainiachkuisha , Nuyá Jíinkirum , nu shuar yajauch ainiawai tusarum , Atumí nawe nunka akakekrum ikiuktiarum . Kame Yus aentsun nekapsattana Nú tsawant jeamtai , nu shuarnaka asutiattawai . Sutuma péprunmaya shuarjai tura Kumura péprunmaya shuarjai nankaamas niin asutiattawai " Tímiayi Jesus .

text: And they went out , and preached that men should repent .
text2: Nuyá Jesusa unuiniamuri Jíinkiar Enentái yapajiar Yúsai Enentáimtumartinian etserkarmiayi .

text: And they cast out many devils , and anointed with oil many that were sick , and healed them .
text2: Tura iwianchruku Enentáiya iwianchin jiirki akupkarmiayi , tura asuitijiai yakarar Untsurí Jáinian tsuararmiayi .

text: And king Herod heard of him ; ( for his name was spread abroad : ) and he said , That John the Baptist was risen from the dead , and therefore mighty works do shew forth themselves in him .
text2: Jesusa Náarin tura ni Túramurin Ashí aents áujmatin ásarmatai , uunt akupin Erutis nuna antukmiayi . Erutiska " Imiakratin Juan jakamunmaya nantakni . Tuma asa ti kakaram takaawai " Tímiayi .

text: Others said , That it is Elias . And others said , That it is a prophet , or as one of the prophets .
text2: Tura Chíkich shuar " Eríasaiti " tiarmiayi . Chikichcha " Yúsnan etserniuiti , yaunchu etserniuya Núkete " tiarmiayi .

text: But when Herod heard thereof , he said , It is John , whom I beheaded : he is risen from the dead .
text2: Erutis nuna antuk " Nekas Juánkaiti . Ni muuken tsupiktinian akupkamiaj nu , jakamunmaya nantakniuiti " Tímiayi .

text: Therefore Herodias had a quarrel against him , and would have killed him ; but she could not :
text2: Kame Uunt akupin Erutis , ni yachi Jiripi nuarin nuatkamiayi . Nu nuwa naari Jirutíasaiti . Juansha uunt akupniun Erutisan chicharuk " Yatsumi Nuarí akintrukchatniuitme " Tímiayi . Tutai nuwa Jirutías Juánkan ti kajerkamiayi . Tura Juánkan Máataj tusa wakerimiayi . Túrasha uunt akupin Erutis nuna surimkiamiayi . Antsu Juan achikrum sepunam enkeatarum tusa akupkamiayi .

text: For Herod feared John , knowing that he was a just man and an holy , and observed him ; and when he heard him , he did many things , and heard him gladly .
text2: Juansha tuke Enentáijiai Yusa jintin wekainiuyayi . Erutis , ni esetar Enentáimniun neka asa Juánkan ashamak Jirutías wakeramurin Túrawain tusa suritkiamiayi . Kame Erutis Juan étserman nékachuitiat antuktinian wakerimiayi .

text: And when a convenient day was come , that Herod on his birthday made a supper to his lords , high captains , and chief estates of Galilee ;
text2: Jirutías , itiurak Máawaj tu pujai , uunt akupin Erutis , ni akiiniamu tsawantri jeamtai , ni suntarincha , Kariréa nunkanmaya uuntrincha , Kuítrintin armia nunasha untsukar , namperan najanamiayi .

text: And when the daughter of the said Herodias came in , and danced , and pleased Herod and them that sat with him , the king said unto the damsel , Ask of me whatsoever thou wilt , and I will give it thee .
text2: Nuisha Jirutíasa nawantri Wayá Jantsemámtai Erutis tura niijiai nampernum matsamarmia nusha shiir Enentáimsarmiayi . Túramtai uunt akupin nuwachin chicharuk " Ame wakeram nu seattia . Wi amastatjai .

text: And he sware unto her , Whatsoever thou shalt ask of me , I will give it thee , unto the half of my kingdom .
text2: Nekas Tájame , Ashí ame seatmena Núnaka amastatjai . Wats , seatkumninkia takakjana nuna Jímiapetek nakakan , amastatjai " Tímiayi .

text: And she went forth , and said unto her mother , What shall I ask ? And she said , The head of John the Baptist .
text2: Tutai nuwach jiinki ni Nukurín Jirutíasan chicharuk " ṡWariniak seattaj ? " Tímiayi . Tutai " Imiakratin Juanka muuke seata " Tímiayi .

text: And she came in straightway with haste unto the king , and asked , saying , I will that thou give me by and by in a charger the head of John the Baptist .
text2: Nu chichamaik nuwach wari Wayá Erutisan chicharuk " Yamaikia uunt amamkunam Juanka muuken wakerajai " Tímiayi .

text: And the king was exceeding sorry ; yet for his oath ' s sake , and for their sakes which sat with him , he would not reject her .
text2: Nuna takui uunt akupin ti kuntuts Enentáimpramiayi . Tura nii tiniu asa ni amikri matsatainia nu antukaru ásarmatai surimkiatniun tujinkiamiayi .

text: And immediately the king sent an executioner , and commanded his head to be brought : and he went and beheaded him in the prison ,
text2: Tuma asa uunt akupin Juanka muuke itiata tusa ni suntarin Wárikmas akupkamiayi .

text: And brought his head in a charger , and gave it to the damsel : and the damsel gave it to her mother .
text2: Túramtai suntar wari we , sepunam Juanka muuken tsupikmiayi . Tsupik , amamkunam Itiá , nuwan susamiayi . Túram achik ni Nukurín susamiayi .

text: And when his disciples heard of it , they came and took up his corpse , and laid it in a tomb .
text2: Juan maamun antukar ni unuiniamuri ni ayashin iwiarsatai tusar Júkiarmiayi .

text: And the apostles gathered themselves together unto Jesus , and told him all things , both what they had done , and what they had taught .
text2: Tura Jesusa unuiniamuri Nii akupkarma nu , ataksha waketki Káunak irunturarmiayi . Ashí nii Túrawarmia nuna , unuiniararmia nunasha ujakarmiayi .

text: And he said unto them , Come ye yourselves apart into a desert place , and rest a while : for there were many coming and going , and they had no leisure so much as to eat .
text2: Tura Untsurí shuar Táiniakui , niisha ankant ajastinniasha Yurumátniuncha tujinkiarmiayi . Tuma asamtai Jesus chichaak " Iijiai Wemí aents atsuiniamunam ; nui ishichik ayamprarmi " Tímiayi .

text: And they departed into a desert place by ship privately .
text2: Nuyá Jesus ni unuiniamurijiai kanunam enkemprar , aents atsuiniamunam jeatai tusar Jíinkiarmiayi .

text: And the people saw them departing , and many knew him , and ran afoot thither out of all cities , and outwent them , and came together unto him .
text2: Túrasha shuar ni wéenan Wáinkiarmiayi . Tura " Jesusaiti " tiarmiayi . Tuma ásar Ashí péprunmaya Untsurí shuar tseke ashintiukar , ni jeatniunam Nákakarmiayi .

text: And Jesus , when he came out , saw much people , and was moved with compassion toward them , because they were as sheep not having a shepherd : and he began to teach them many things .
text2: Jesus kanunmaya jiinki ti Untsurí aents iruntrar matsatun Wáinkiamiayi . Murik pénker Wáinchataiya Núnisan matsatu ásarmatai Jesus niin Wáitnentrarmiayi . Tura Núkap unuiniararmiayi .

text: And when the day was now far spent , his disciples came unto him , and said , This is a desert place , and now the time is far passed :
text2: Nuyá kiakui ni unuiniamuri Jesusan tariar chicharainiak " Atsamunam pujatsjik ; tura Yamái Kíatsuk .

text: Send them away , that they may go into the country round about , and into the villages , and buy themselves bread : for they have nothing to eat .
text2: Shuar wari akupkarta . Tíjiuch péprunmasha , shuarnumsha wearti , ni yurumkari sumarmakarat ~ i " tiarmiayi .

text: He answered and said unto them , Give ye them to eat . And they say unto him , Shall we go and buy two hundred pennyworth of bread , and give them to eat ?
text2: Tutai Jesus chichaak " Atumek ayuratarum " Tímiayi . Tutai " Iisha ju shuar ayuratai tusar , ṡJimiará sian kuitjai yurumak sumaktai tusar wétinkiaitiaj ~ i ? " tiarmiayi .

text: He saith unto them , How many loaves have ye ? go and see . And when they knew , they say , Five , and two fishes .
text2: Tura Jesus ni unuiniamurin chicharainiak " Tanta takakrum nu iistarum ṡurutmak aa ? " Tímiayi . Tutai nekapmarar chichainiak " Tántaka sénkuchikiiti , tura namaksha Jímiarchikiiti " tiarmiayi .

text: And he commanded them to make all sit down by companies upon the green grass .
text2: Tutai Jesus Tímiayi " Ju shuar Chírichriniam pujusarti tusar akupkatarum . "

text: And they sat down in ranks , by hundreds , and by fifties .
text2: Ankant ankant sian siansha , senkuenta senkuenta iruntrar matsamsarmiayi .

text: And when he had taken the five loaves and the two fishes , he looked up to heaven , and blessed , and brake the loaves , and gave them to his disciples to set before them ; and the two fishes divided he among them all .
text2: Jesuska senku tantancha , Jímiar namaknasha jusa , Yakí nayaimpinmaani iimias Yúsan yuminsamiayi . Tura yurumkan Púurmiayi . Puur ni unuiniamurin Súsarmiayi . Namaknasha puur Súsarmiayi , Ashí Shuáran ajamsarat tusa .

text: And they did all eat , and were filled .
text2: Ashí Yurumáwar ejemararmatai ,

text: And they took up twelve baskets full of the fragments , and of the fishes .
text2: puunaruncha , namak ampirmancha achikiar , tuse chankinian aimkiar Júkiarmiayi .

text: And they that did eat of the loaves were about five thousand men .
text2: Nu yurumkan ti Untsurí Yurumáwarmiayi . Aya aishmankak senku mir ( 5 . 000 ) ármiayi .

text: And straightway he constrained his disciples to get into the ship , and to go to the other side before unto Bethsaida , while he sent away the people .
text2: Nuyá Jesus ni unuiniamurin chicharainiak " Kanunam enkemprarum , katinkrum amain émaa ajatarum , Petsaitia péprunam . Wisha ju shuaran áujsan ikiuktiatjai " Tímiayi .

text: And when he had sent them away , he departed into a mountain to pray .
text2: Shuáran áujas ikiuki Yusjai chichastaj tusa Náinnium wémiayi .

text: And when even was come , the ship was in the midst of the sea , and he alone on the land .
text2: Tura kirit ajasmanum Kánuka antumiannum ajapén nanammiayi . Jesuska ninki juakmiayi .

text: And he saw them toiling in rowing ; for the wind was contrary unto them : and about the fourth watch of the night he cometh unto them , walking upon the sea , and would have passed by them .
text2: Jesusa unuiniamurisha wia - wiantainiakua ti pimpikiarmiayi , nase tukumma ásar . Nuna Jesus Wáiniak tsawartin ishichik ajasmatai Entsá Pátatek wekas niin jeariarmiayi . Tura nankaamaktiasa wea Núnisan wémiayi .

text: But when they saw him walking upon the sea , they supposed it had been a spirit , and cried out :
text2: Jesus Entsá wekaan ni unuiniamuri Wáinkiar , wakanchashit , tu Enentáimprarmiayi . Túrawar ti untsumkarmiayi .

text: For they all saw him , and were troubled . And immediately he talked with them , and saith unto them , Be of good cheer : it is I ; be not afraid .
text2: Ashí Wáinkiar ti ashamkarmiayi . Tura Jesus Wárik niin chicharuk " Kakaram ajastarum , Wíitjai Jesus ; ashamprukairap " Tímiayi .

text: For they considered not the miracle of the loaves : for their heart was hardened .
text2: Nuinkia entsaya kanunam waka enkempramiayi . Túramtai nasesha majaantmiayi . Ni unuiniamurinkia Enentái kiritia aintsan ásarmatai Jesus yurumkan Núkap awajsamia nuna paant nekaatniun tuke tujinkiarmiayi . Tuma ásar Yamái Túrunamu itiurak aankia tusar ti Enentáimprar sapijmiakarmiayi .

text: And when they had passed over , they came into the land of Gennesaret , and drew to the shore .
text2: Nuyanka katinkiar , Jinisarít Núnkanam jeawarmiayi . Jeawar kanun ajuiniarmiayi .

text: And when they were come out of the ship , straightway they knew him ,
text2: Kanunmaya Jíintrarmatai , nu nunkanmaya shuar Jesusan nekaawarmiayi .

text: And ran through that whole region round about , and began to carry about in beds those that were sick , where they heard he was .
text2: Tura " Jesus pujawai " Táman antukar , Ashí jeanmaya jaan ni peakrintiuk Jesus pujamunam itiaarmiayi .

text: And whithersoever he entered , into villages , or cities , or country , they laid the sick in the streets , and besought him that they might touch if it were but the border of his garment : and as many as touched him were made whole .
text2: Tura Jesus wekaak wémia nuisha , péprunmasha , shuar matsatmanumsha , ishichik matsatkamunmasha jaan itiariar Jintiá aeprusarmiayi . Túmainiak Jesusan pushirmin antintaj tusar seawarmiayi . Tura Ashí antinkiarmia nuka pénker ajasarmiayi .

text: Then came together unto him the Pharisees , and certain of the scribes , which came from Jerusalem .
text2: Pariséusha , Israer - shuara jintinniurisha Jerusarénnumia Jesusan tariarmiayi .

text: And when they saw some of his disciples eat bread with defiled , that is to say , with unwashen , hands , they found fault .
text2: Tura Jesusa unuiniamurin ikijmiatsuk yurumun Wáinkiar " Israer - shuara Túrutairin Túruiniatsui " tiarmiayi .

text: For the Pharisees , and all the Jews , except they wash their hands oft , eat not , holding the tradition of the elders .
text2: ( Kame Pariséusha , tura Ashí Israer - shuarsha , ni uuntri jintintiamurin umikiar ti Núkap ikijmiarar yurumin ármiayi .

text: And when they come from the market , except they wash , they eat not . And many other things there be , which they have received to hold , as the washing of cups , and pots , brasen vessels , and of tables .
text2: Péprunmaya tari " ikijmiatsuk Yurumáshtiniaiti " tiniu ármiayi . Tura ti Untsurí ni uuntri Túrutairi Núnisan ármiayi . " Tsapancha , ichinnasha , jiruncha , peaknasha nijiakartiniaiti " tiniu ármiayi . )

text: Then the Pharisees and scribes asked him , Why walk not thy disciples according to the tradition of the elders , but eat bread with unwashen hands ?
text2: Tuma asamtai Pariséusha , Israer - shuara jintinniurisha Jesusan chicharainiak " ṡUrukamtai ame unuiniamuram ii uuntri jintintramniuitiaj nuna Túruiniatsu . Urukamtai ikijmiatskesha Yurumáinia ? " tiarmiayi .

text: He answered and said unto them , Well hath Esaias prophesied of you hypocrites , as it is written , This people honoureth me with their lips , but their heart is far from me .
text2: Tutai Jesus Tímiayi " Antar chichamtiniaitrume . Isayas yaunchu nekas atumin aartampramiayi juna : Ju aents ni wenejai Winia " ti pénkeraiti " turutainiawai , Tímiayi Yus , tura ni Enentáinkia jeachat pujuiniawai .

text: Howbeit in vain do they worship me , teaching for doctines the commandments of men .
text2: Tura tukeneas Winia shiir awajtuiniawai . Aentsu chichame jintiainiayat , " Yus - Chichamaiti " Tuíniawai . " Tu aarmaiti .

text: For laying aside the commandment of God , ye hold the tradition of men , as the washing of pots and cups : and many other such like things ye do .
text2: Tura átum Yusa chichame iniaisarum , aentsu jintintiamuri umirkarum , ichinnasha , tsapancha nijiaktin , tura Chíkich Túrutaisha aintsarmek Untsurí Túrarme .

text: And he said unto them , Full well ye reject the commandment of God , that ye may keep your own tradition .
text2: Túrákrum Yus - Chichamka tsukintiaani ikiusurme Atumí uuntri chichame umirkatai tusarum .

text: For Moses said , Honour thy father and thy mother ; and , Whoso curseth father or mother , let him die the death :
text2: Kame Muisais yaunchu aar juna Tíchamka : Ame apa nukusha shiir Enentáimtustarum . Tura ataksha aarmiayi : Shuarsha ni Aparín , Nukuríncha yajauch chichareakka , nu shuar Jákatniuiti .

text: And ye suffer him no more to do ought for his father or his mother ;
text2: Túrasha átumka Pariséutirmeka , antsu ju Tárume : " Shuar ni Aparín ni Nukurín chicharuk " Wi Yáintinian takakjana nu Kurpanaiti " takuinkia , atumsha pénkeraiti , aparincha nukurincha Yáinchatí " tarume . ( Kurpan tana nuka , Yus susamu , tawai . )

text: Making the word of God of none effect through your tradition , which ye have delivered : and many such like things do ye .
text2: Nekaatarum , Pariséutiram . " Ií yaunchu uuntri chichame tuke umiki wétiniaitji " Tákurum , Yus - Chicham penké ántar chichama Núnin awajearme . Núnisrumek chikichcha Untsurí Túrarme . " Tu timiayi Jesus .

text: And when he had called all the people unto him , he said unto them , Hearken unto me every one of you , and understand :
text2: Nuyá ataksha Jesus Ashí Shuáran untsukar " Mash anturtuktarum , Ashí nekaatarum , Tímiayi .

text: There is nothing from without a man , that entering into him can defile him : but the things which come out of him , those are they that defile the man .
text2: Aaya ayashnium wayaana nu , Shuáran yajauch awajsachminiaiti ; tura antsu ni Enentáinia jiinia nu , yajauch awajsattawai .

text: If any man have ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Shuar nuna ántakka Enentáimprati " Tímiayi .

text: And when he was entered into the house from the people , his disciples asked him concerning the parable .
text2: Nuyá aentsun ikuiak , jea wayamtai , ni unuiniamuri aniasarmiayi " ṡNu métek - taku chicham warintiua ? " tiarmiayi .

text: And he saith unto them , Are ye so without understanding also ? Do ye not perceive , that whatsoever thing from without entereth into the man , it cannot defile him ;
text2: Tutai Jesus Tímiayi " Atumsha nékatsrumek . Páantchakait ; yurumak Yúajnia nu , Enentáiniam wayachu asa , Shuáran yajauch awajsachminiaiti .

text: Because it entereth not into his heart , but into the belly , and goeth out into the draught , purging all meats ?
text2: Antsu wakenam Wayá , nankaamas menkaatsuk " Tímiayi . Nuna taku , Ashí yurumak Páchitsuk yuamniaiti , Tímiayi .

text: And he said , That which cometh out of the man , that defileth the man .
text2: Nuyá Tímiayi " Shuara Enentáinia jiinia nu , yajauch awajsamniaiti .

text: For from within , out of the heart of men , proceed evil thoughts , adulteries , fornications , murders ,
text2: Shuara Enentáinia , initia , yajauch Enentáimsatniusha , tsanirmatniusha , natsa tsanirmatniusha , shuar Máatniusha ,

text: Thefts , covetousness , wickedness , deceit , lasciviousness , an evil eye , blasphemy , pride , foolishness :
text2: kasamkatniusha , chikichna wakeruktincha , pénkercha Túratniusha , anankatniusha , natsantain átincha , yajauch Enentáimtustincha , tsanumpratniusha , waantu Enentáimtumastincha , netse Túratniusha , Ashí nuka initia wininiatsuk .

text: All these evil things come from within , and defile the man .
text2: Ashí nu Tunáa ainia nu , shuara Enentáinia Jíiniu asa , Shuáran yajauch awajainiawai " Tímiayi .

text: And from thence he arose , and went into the borders of Tyre and Sidon , and entered into an house , and would have no man know it : but he could not be hid .
text2: Tiru pepru , Setún péprusha Serupinísia nunkanam ámiayi . Nuka Israer - shuara nunkenchauyayi . Nu nunkanam Jesus wémiayi . Tura Jeá , Jeá Wayáa pujusmiayi . Tura nui pujamun nu nunkanmaya shuar nekarawarain tusa nakitmiayi ; Túrasha uumkatniun tujinkiamiayi .

text: For a certain woman , whose young daughter had an unclean spirit , heard of him , and came and fell at his feet :
text2: Wárik nu nunkanmaya nuwa Jesus pujan nekaamiayi . Nu Núwaka nawantri iwianchrukuyayi . Tuma asa Jesusan Tarí ni nawen piniakum tepersamiayi .

text: The woman was a Greek , a Syrophenician by nation ; and she besought him that he would cast forth the devil out of her daughter .
text2: Nu nuwa Israer - shuarcha , Serupinísianmayauyayi . Túmaitiat , nawantru Enentáiya iwianchin jiirturkitia tusa Jesusan seamiayi .

text: But Jesus said unto her , Let the children first be filled : for it is not meet to take the children ' s bread , and to cast it unto the dogs .
text2: Tutai Jesus nuwan chicharuk " Uchi emka Ejemarartí . Uchi apatkuri atankir yawach Súsatin pénkerchaiti " Tímiayi .

text: And she answered and said unto him , Yes , Lord : yet the dogs under the table eat of the children ' s crumbs .
text2: Tutai nuwa ayak " Nekas , Uunta , tame . Tura yawachisha misanam wakenam pujuinia nu , uchi apatkun yurumuk juyumak Kákeamun Yuíniatsuk " Tímiayi .

text: And he said unto her , For this saying go thy way ; the devil is gone out of thy daughter .
text2: Tutai Jesus Tímiayi " Pénker tame . Tuma asam , shiir Wetá ; ame nawantrumi Enentáiya iwianch Jíinkiyi " Tímiayi .

text: And when she was come to her house , she found the devil gone out , and her daughter laid upon the bed .
text2: Takui niisha wémiayi . Tura ni jeen Jeá , ni nawantrin íwianch Jíinkimtai pénker ajas peaknum tepan Wáinkiamiayi .

text: And again , departing from the coasts of Tyre and Sidon , he came unto the sea of Galilee , through the midst of the coasts of Decapolis .
text2: Jesus Tirunmaya jiinki Setún péprunam nankaamarkutak , Tekapuris nunkanmaani nankaamaki , Kariréa antumiannum ataksha jeamiayi .

text: And they bring unto him one that was deaf , and had an impediment in his speech ; and they beseech him to put his hand upon him .
text2: Nui chichachu ámiayi , kuishin empeku . Nu Shuáran Jesusan itiariar , ni uwejejai antinkiat tusar seawarmiayi .

text: And he took him aside from the multitude , and put his fingers into his ears , and he spit , and touched his tongue ;
text2: Shuar matsatmanumia Jesus niin akanki Jukí kuishin tsara uwejejai tsutsukruamiayi . Tura usukia , nu shuara iniain antintkiamiayi .

text: And looking up to heaven , he sighed , and saith unto him , Ephphatha , that is , Be opened .
text2: Tura nayaimpinmaani iimias Súkaska mayati " Epata " Tímiayi . Nuka , shuar chichamnumka " Chinkiatí " tawai .

text: And straightway his ears were opened , and the string of his tongue was loosed , and he spake plain .
text2: Nu chichamaik ni kuishisha chinkiamiayi , iniaisha séermiayi . Tura paant chichasmiayi .

text: And he charged them that they should tell no man : but the more he charged them , so much the more a great deal they published it ;
text2: Tura Jesus chicharainiak " Penké etserkairap " Tímiayi . Jesuska Surí - suritiamaitiat , nu nankaamas etseriarmiayi .

text: And were beyond measure astonished , saying , He hath done all things well : he maketh both the deaf to hear , and the dumb to speak .
text2: Tura ti Enentáimprarmiayi . Enentáimprar , " Ju Jesus aya pénkeran Túrawai . Empekuncha ántumtikniaiti , tura chichachun chichamtikniaiti " tiarmiayi .

text: In those days the multitude being very great , and having nothing to eat , Jesus called his disciples unto him , and saith unto them ,
text2: Nu Tsawantái shuar Timiá Untsurí iruntrarmiayi . Yurumkari atsakui Jesus ni unuiniamurin untsukar juna Tímiayi :

text: I have compassion on the multitude , because they have now been with me three days , and have nothing to eat :
text2: " Ju Shuáran waitnentajai . Menaintiú tsawant Wijiai pujuinia ásarmatai ni yurumkari amuukachaik .

text: And if I send them away fasting to their own houses , they will faint by the way : for divers of them came from far .
text2: Tura ni jeen ayurtsuk akupeamka , tsukariin Jintiá pimpikiartatui , yajaya Káunkaru ásar " Tímiayi .

text: And his disciples answered him , From whence can a man satisfy these men with bread here in the wilderness ?
text2: Tutai ni unuiniamuri chichainiak " Túrasha jui atsamunam , ju aents ejemararat tusar ṡTuyá yurumkak Wáinkiattaj ~ i ? " tiarmiayi .

text: And he asked them , How many loaves have ye ? And they said , Seven .
text2: Tutai Jesus niin aniasmiayi " ṡUrutmá tanta aa ? " Tutai " siati awai " tiarmiayi .

text: And he commanded the people to sit down on the ground : and he took the seven loaves , and gave thanks , and brake , and gave to his disciples to set before them ; and they did set them before the people .
text2: Nuinkia Ashí aentsun " Nunká pujustarum " tiarmiayi . Tura tantan achik , Yúsan yuminsamiayi . Tura puuk , aentsun ajamsatarum tusa ni unuiniamurin susamiayi .

text: And they had a few small fishes : and he blessed , and commanded to set them also before them .
text2: Tura uchich namaksha ishichik aan achik , Yúsan yuminkias , ni unuiniamurin chicharuk " Jusha shuar ajamsatarum " Tímiayi .

text: So they did eat , and were filled : and they took up of the broken meat that was left seven baskets .
text2: Turam Ashí Yurumáwar ejemararmiayi . Ampirma Púunaruncha siati chankinnium aimkiarmiayi .

text: And they that had eaten were about four thousand : and he sent them away .
text2: Kuatru mir ( 4 . 000 ) shuar Yurumáwarmiayi . Yurumáwar amikiarmatai , Jesus niin áujas akupkarmiayi .

text: And straightway he entered into a ship with his disciples , and came into the parts of Dalmanutha .
text2: Tura ni unuiniamurijiai kanunam enkemprar Tarmanúta nunkanam wearmiayi .

text: And the Pharisees came forth , and began to question with him , seeking of him a sign from heaven , tempting him .
text2: Pariséu Jesusjai áujmatsatai tusar tariarmiayi . Nekapsatai tusar wakeruiniak Niin chicharuk " Nayaimpinmaya kakaram iniakmasta " tiarmiayi .

text: And he sighed deeply in his spirit , and saith , Why doth this generation seek after a sign ? verily I say unto you , There shall no sign be given unto this generation .
text2: Tuíniakui Jesus Kúntuts Enentáimias , Súkaska mayati " ṡUrukamtai , yamaiya aentstiram , nayaimpinmaya kakarman iniakmasat tusarum wakerarum ? Nuka penké sunaschattarme , paant Tájarme " Tímiayi .

text: And he left them , and entering into the ship again departed to the other side .
text2: Nuyá niin ikiukiar ataksha kanunam enkemar amain katinmiayi .

text: Now the disciples had forgotten to take bread , neither had they in the ship with them more than one loaf .
text2: Tura ni unuiniamuri yurumak jukitiai Tukamá kajinmatkiarmiayi . Kanunmanka aya chikichik tantanak takaku ármiayi .

text: And he charged them , saying , Take heed , beware of the leaven of the Pharisees , and of the leaven of Herod .
text2: Jesussha ni unuiniamurin Enentáimtikiuk Tímiayi " Wáinkiatarum ; Pariséusha Erutissha wakaprutain takakainia Nújaisha aneartarum " Tímiayi .

text: And they reasoned among themselves , saying , It is because we have no bread .
text2: Tutai ni unuiniamurisha tunaiyarmiayi " Tanta kajinmatkin asakrin nuna Túramtsujiash " tiarmiayi .

text: And when Jesus knew it , he saith unto them , Why reason ye , because ye have no bread ? perceive ye not yet , neither understand ? have ye your heart yet hardened ?
text2: Tura Jesus nuna Nekáa chichaak " ṡUrukamtai aya yurumkak Enentáimtarum ? Tuke nékatsrumek . Penké Enentáimtsurmek . Atumí Enentái tuke kiritkiait ? Tímiayi .

text: Having eyes , see ye not ? and having ears , hear ye not ? and do ye not remember ?
text2: Jimi aisha itiura Wáintsurmea . Kuíshim aisha itiura ántatsrum . Ashí kajinmatkintrumek .

text: When I brake the five loaves among five thousand , how many baskets full of fragments took ye up ? They say unto him , Twelve .
text2: Nekaatarum , nuik , senku tantan Púuran senku mir aishmankan ayurachmakaj . ṡTura ampirma Urutmá chankinnium chumpiamarum ? " Tímiayi . Niisha tiarmiayi " Tuse chankinnium chumpiamji . "

text: And when the seven among four thousand , how many baskets full of fragments took ye up ? And they said , Seven .
text2: Ataksha Jesus Tímiayi " Tura siati tantajai kuatru mir shuaran ayuramtai , ṡampirmasha Urutmá chankinnium chumpiamarum ? " Niisha " siati " tiarmiayi .

text: And he said unto them , How is it that ye do not understand ?
text2: Tuma asamtai Jesus Tímiayi " ṡItiura Imiá nékatsrum ? "

text: And he cometh to Bethsaida ; and they bring a blind man unto him , and besought him to touch him .
text2: Nuyá Petsaitia péprunam jeawarmiayi . Jeawarmatai , aishman jii kusurun Jesusan itiariarmiayi . Túrawar antinta tusar seawarmiayi .

text: And he took the blind man by the hand , and led him out of the town ; and when he had spit on his eyes , and put his hands upon him , he asked him if he saw ought .
text2: Tuma asamtai Jesus uwejnum achik péprunam aani enkeki Jukí jiin usukijiai kuérmiayi . Tura uwejéjai antin " ṡíimmek ? " Tímiayi .

text: And he looked up , and said , I see men as trees , walking .
text2: Tutai kusuru iimi Tímiayi " Aentsun iiyajai , Túrasha paantcha . Numi wekainian aaniun iiyajai " Tímiayi .

text: After that he put his hands again upon his eyes , and made him look up : and he was restored , and saw every man clearly .
text2: Nuyá ataksha Jesus ni uwejéjai kusuru jiin antinmiayi . Tura kusurusha úmamkes iis , pénker ajas , Ashí paant iimpramiayi .

text: And he sent him away to his house , saying , Neither go into the town , nor tell it to any in the town .
text2: Jesus chichaak " Jeemiin weakum péprunam wayawaip tura shuar ujakaip " Tímiayi .

text: And Jesus went out , and his disciples , into the towns of Caesarea Philippi : and by the way he asked his disciples , saying unto them , Whom do men say that I am ?
text2: Jesus ni unuiniamurijiai uunt pepru Sesaria - jiripiunam jeatsuk , Tíjiuch uchich péprunam irasarmiayi . Jintiá wésar Jesus ni unuiniamurin chicharainiak , " ṡYaiti turutainiawa Winia ? " Tímiayi .

text: And they answered , John the Baptist : but some say , Elias ; and others , One of the prophets .
text2: Tutai niisha aimkiarmiayi " Chíkich chichainiak , imiakratin Juankaiti , turamainiawai . Chíkichcha , Eríasaiti , tura Chíkichkia , yaunchu Yúsnan etserin nantakniua Núiti , turamainiawai " tiarmiayi .

text: And he saith unto them , But whom say ye that I am ? And Peter answereth and saith unto him , Thou art the Christ .
text2: Tutai Jesus Tímiayi " Atumsha , ṡwaritrume . Yáitiaj ? " Tímiayi . Tutai Pítiur Tímiayi " Ameka Krístuitme ; Yúsaiya akupkamuitme . "

text: And he charged them that they should tell no man of him .
text2: Tutai Jesus chichaak " Penké etserkairap " Tímiayi .

text: And he began to teach them , that the Son of man must suffer many things , and be rejected of the elders , and of the chief priests , and scribes , and be killed , and after three days rise again .
text2: Unuiniak : " Wi Aents Ajasuitjiana ju ti Wáitsatniuitjai . Israer - shuarti ii uuntrisha , Patri uuntrisha , ii jintinniurisha Winia nakitrurar mantuawartatui . Túrasha menaintiu tsawant nankaamasmatai nantaktiniaitjai " Tímiayi .

text: And he spake that saying openly . And Peter took him , and began to rebuke him .
text2: Nunasha paant ujakmiayi . Tura Pítrusha Jesusan arantach Jukí kakantramiayi . " Tu chichasaip " Tímiayi .

text: But when he had turned about and looked on his disciples , he rebuked Peter , saying , Get thee behind me , Satan : for thou savourest not the things that be of God , but the things that be of men .
text2: Tutai Jesus ayantmatar , ni Unuiniamurín iis , Pítrun kakantar chicharuk " Satanása , werumta . Ameka Yusna ana nu Enentáimtatsme , antsu aya aentsnak Enentáimtame " Tímiayi .

text: And when he had called the people unto him with his disciples also , he said unto them , Whosoever will come after me , let him deny himself , and take up his cross , and follow me .
text2: Nuna tuasua amik tura nui matsamarmia nunasha , ni unuiniamurincha untsuk Tímiayi , " Shuar Winia nekas nemartustasa wakerakka ni wakeramurinkia iniaisati ; tura ni krusri yanaki Nemartustí .

text: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it ; but whosoever shall lose his life for my sake and the gospel ' s , the same shall save it .
text2: Kame shuar ju nunkanam aya ninki anenmamkunka nu shuar ni iwiaakmarin emenkaktatui . Antsu Winia anentu asa tura winia chichamprun anea asa , shuar aya pénker pujustinniak Enentáimtsuna nu , nekas iwiaakman Wáinkiattawai .

text: For what shall it profit a man , if he shall gain the whole world , and lose his own soul ?
text2: Nekaata , shuar Ashí ju nunkanam írunna nuna sumaksha Túrasha ni wakani jinium wéakuisha , ṡitiurak pénker pujusaint ?

text: Or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul ?
text2: Shuarka wakanin uwemtikrataj tusa wakerak ṡurutmak akikmakaint ?

text: Whosoever therefore shall be ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous and sinful generation ; of him also shall the Son of man be ashamed , when he cometh in the glory of his Father with the holy angels .
text2: Antuktarum . Yamaiya aents Yúsan nakitiar ajapawaru yajauch ainia nu iimiainiamunam shuar Winia natsantrakuinkia tura winia chichampruncha natsantakuinkia , wi , Aents Ajasuitjiana ju , winia Aparu kakarmarijiai tura nayaimpinmaya pénker suntarjai atak taakun , Nú shuaran natsantrattajai Wisha . ' Tu Tímiayi Jesus .

text: And he said unto them , Verily I say unto you , That there be some of them that stand here , which shall not taste of death , till they have seen the kingdom of God come with power .
text2: Ataksha Jesus niin chicharuk , ` Nekas Tájarme , shuar Játsuk Yus ni kakarmarijiai aentsu Enentáin akupkattana Nú tsawantan Wáinkiartatna nu jui iijiai pujuiniawai " Tímiayi .

text: And after six days Jesus taketh with him Peter , and James , and John , and leadeth them up into an high mountain apart by themselves : and he was transfigured before them .
text2: Nuyá sais tsawant nankaamasmatai , Jesus Pítruncha , Jakupuncha , Juánnasha uunt Náinnium Júkiarmiayi . Nuisha Jesus Nushá iira ajasmiayi .

text: And his raiment became shining , exceeding white as snow ; so as no fuller on earth can white them .
text2: Ni pushirisha ti puju Jíitsumir ajattsarmiayi . Nujai métek puju awajsatin ju nunkanam atsawai .

text: And there appeared unto them Elias with Moses : and they were talking with Jesus .
text2: Túruna nui Erías , Muisaisjai wantinkiar Jesusjai chichainian Wáinkiarmiayi .

text: And Peter answered and said to Jesus , Master , it is good for us to be here : and let us make three tabernacles ; one for thee , and one for Moses , and one for Elias .
text2: Nuyasha Pítiur Jesusan chicharuk " Uuntá , ii jui pujustin ti pénkeraiti . Menaintiú aakmaktai , Aminiu chikichik , Muisaisna chikichik , Eríasnasha chikichik " Tímiayi .

text: For he wist not what to say ; for they were sore afraid .
text2: Jesusa unuiniamuri sapijmainiak , Pítiur wariniak titi nekaachmiayi . Nékachu asa nuna Tímiayi .

text: And there was a cloud that overshadowed them : and a voice came out of the cloud , saying , This is my beloved Son : hear him .
text2: Tura yurankim tara mikintiu awajsamiayi . Yuranminmaya chichaak " Júiti winia aneamu Uchir . Nii anturkatarum " Tímiayi .

text: And suddenly , when they had looked round about , they saw no man any more , save Jesus only with themselves .
text2: Nuyanka ni unuiniamuri ayantmar iiyaj tukamar aya Jesusnak Wáinkiarmiayi . Chíkichkia atsuarmiayi .

text: And as they came down from the mountain , he charged them that they should tell no man what things they had seen , till the Son of man were risen from the dead .
text2: Nuyá Náinniumia akainiak Jesus niin chicharuk " Wáinkiarumna nu etserkairap . Wi , Aents Ajasuitjiana ju jakamunmaya nantaatsain nu etserkairap " Tímiayi .

text: And they kept that saying with themselves , questioning one with another what the rising from the dead should mean .
text2: Tutai ni Tímian ímiatrusan úukarmiayi . Tura " jakamunmaya nantaatsain tana nu , ṡwariniak ta ? " nuamtak tunainiarmiayi .

text: And they asked him , saying , Why say the scribes that Elias must first come ?
text2: Tura Jesusan aniasarmiayi " ṡUrukamtai Israerti ii jintinniurisha , Erías emka Tátiniaiti , tuinia ? " tiarmiayi .

text: And he answered and told them , Elias verily cometh first , and restoreth all things ; and how it is written of the Son of man , that he must suffer many things , and be set at nought .
text2: Tutai Jesus Tímiayi " Nekas Erías Ashí iwiarattsa emka Tátiniaiti . ṡTura Aents Ajasunun Yus - Papinium warintiua ? " Ti Wáitsattawai ; Niin nakitrartatui . " Tu aarmaiti .

text: But I say unto you , That Elias is indeed come , and they have done unto him whatsoever they listed , as it is written of him .
text2: Wi Tájarme , Erías nekas Táwiti . Támatai , shuar Ashí ni wakeriarmia nuna niin Túrawarmiayi . Yusa Papiriin Eríasa Túrunatniuri aarma amia Tímiatrusan Túrawarmiayi " Tímiayi Jesus .

text: And when he came to his disciples , he saw a great multitude about them , and the scribes questioning with them .
text2: Tura ni unuiniamuri matsatmanum atak Wáketuk , ti Untsurí aents Káutkar Israer - shuara jintinniurisha niijiai tunai pujuinian Wáinkiamiayi .

text: And straightway all the people , when they beheld him , were greatly amazed , and running to him saluted him .
text2: Tura aencha , Jesusan Wáinkiar warainiak , tsékenki weriar , áujsarmiayi .

text: And he asked the scribes , What question ye with them ?
text2: Túrunawarmatai , Jesus chicharainiak , " Warí tunaiyarum ? " Tímiayi .

text: And one of the multitude answered and said , Master , I have brought unto thee my son , which hath a dumb spirit ;
text2: Tutai chikichik ayak " Uuntá , winia uchirun Amin itiarjame . Iwianchruku asa chichachuiti .

text: And wheresoever he taketh him , he teareth him : and he foameth , and gnasheth with his teeth , and pineth away : and I spake to thy disciples that they should cast him out ; and they could not .
text2: Túmakui íwianch enkemtakun paat ajiar aepeawai ; Túram uchisha saun kaput apak nain Kátetete awajeawai . Túram kakaakcha ame unuiniamurmin seamjai , Jíirtukti tusan , Túrasha tujintrutkarai " Tímiayi .

text: He answereth him , and saith , O faithless generation , how long shall I be with you ? how long shall I suffer you ? bring him unto me .
text2: Tutai Jesus Tímiayi " Yúsan Enentáimtichutirmea Urutmá tsawantak pujustaj atumjai . Urutmá katsuntrataj ! Uchi itiatarum " Tímiayi .

text: And they brought him unto him : and when he saw him , straightway the spirit tare him ; and he fell on the ground , and wallowed foaming .
text2: Takui uchin Jesusan itiariarmiayi . Tura íwianch uchin enkemta Jesusan Wáiniak uchin ajakramiayi . Uchisha chichiptur Nunká iniaan péper - péper ajakin wenunam saun apakmiayi .

text: And he asked his father , How long is it ago since this came unto him ? And he said , Of a child .
text2: Túrunamtai Jesus ni Aparín aniasmiayi " ṡUrutá yaunchu ainkiait ? " Tutai ni apari Tímiayi " úchichik ainkiaiti .

text: And ofttimes it hath cast him into the fire , and into the waters , to destroy him : but if thou canst do any thing , have compassion on us , and help us .
text2: Tuma asa tuke Jutikiú pujurniuiti ; jiniumsha apeawai , Entsá maataj tusa ajuaawai . Yaintrukminiaitkiumka waitneasam yaintrukta " Tímiayi .

text: Jesus said unto him , If thou canst believe , all things are possible to him that believeth .
text2: Tutai Jesus chicharuk " ṡUrukamtai , yaintrukminiaitkiumka , tame ? Nekaata , shuar Winia nekas Enentáimturna nu Ashí Túramniaiti " Tímiayi .

text: And straightway the father of the child cried out , and said with tears , Lord , I believe ; help thou mine unbelief .
text2: Tutai uchi apari kakantar chichaak , " Uuntá , nekas Enentáimtajme . Nekas Enentáimtustinian Táasjana nu Yáintkiata " Tímiayi .

text: When Jesus saw that the people came running together , he rebuked the foul spirit , saying unto him , Thou dumb and deaf spirit , I charge thee , come out of him , and enter no more into him .
text2: Tura shuar Untsurí Káunainian Jesus Wáiniak kakantuk " Empeku chichachu awajin iwianchi Jíinkitia , Tájame . Jíinkim ataksha wayawaipia " Tímiayi .

text: And the spirit cried , and rent him sore , and came out of him : and he was as one dead ; insomuch that many said , He is dead .
text2: Tura íwianch jiiniuk untsumak uchin we - werkasa ajakar chichichiptu aepkimiayi . Túram uchi jaka ímianis tepemiayi . Túrunamtai Untsurí shuar " jakayi " tiarmiayi .

text: But Jesus took him by the hand , and lifted him up ; and he arose .
text2: Támanak Jesus uwejen achik awajkimiayi , tura uchi nantaki wajakmiayi .

text: And when he was come into the house , his disciples asked him privately , Why could not we cast him out ?
text2: Tura Jesus Jeá wayamtai , ninki pujusar , ni unuiniamuri aniasar " ṡUrukamtai iisha Jíiktin tujinkiamaj ~ i ? " tiarmiayi .

text: And he said unto them , This kind can come forth by nothing , but by prayer and fasting .
text2: Tutai Jesus Tímiayi " Ju iwianchkia ijiarmar Yus áujkur jiikminiaiti " Tímiayi .

text: And they departed thence , and passed through Galilee ; and he would not that any man should know it .
text2: Nuyá Jíinkiar Kariréa nunkanmaani nankaamakarmiayi . Ni unuiniamurin unuinia asa nu nankaamamun nekaawarain tusa Jesus nakitmiayi .

text: For he taught his disciples , and said unto them , The Son of man is delivered into the hands of men , and they shall kill him ; and after that he is killed , he shall rise the third day .
text2: Unuiniak juna Tímiayi : " Wi Aents Ajasuitiaj juna mantamnati tusar achirkar surutkartatui . Tura Máamuitiatnak , iwiarsamunmayan Menaintiú tsawantai nantaktiatjai " Tímiayi .

text: But they understood not that saying , and were afraid to ask him .
text2: Tura nu chichaman nekaacharmiayi . Nékainiachiat , anintrustinian arantukarmiayi .

text: And he came to Capernaum : and being in the house he asked them , What was it that ye disputed among yourselves by the way ?
text2: Nuyá Kapernáum péprunam jeawarmiayi . Tura Jesus Jeá pujus ni unuiniamurin aniniak , " ṡAtumsha Jintiá winisrum Warí áujmatmiarum ? " Tímiayi .

text: But they held their peace : for by the way they had disputed among themselves , who should be the greatest .
text2: Tura natsarar pachischarmiayi . Kame Jintiá wésar " iijiai ṡyaki Imiá nankaamantu ajasat ? " tunainiarmiayi .

text: And he sat down , and called the twelve , and saith unto them , If any man desire to be first , the same shall be last of all , and servant of all .
text2: Ni unuiniamuri pachischarmatai , Jesus pujus Ashí tuse unuiniamurin irur chichaak " Shuar nekas nankaamantu ajastajtsa wakerakka , peejchachia nuke Enentáimtumar shuara Yáintri Atí " Tímiayi .

text: And he took a child , and set him in the midst of them : and when he had taken him in his arms , he said unto them ,
text2: Tura uchin Itiáa miniakas chichaak :

text: Whosoever shall receive one of such children in my name , receiveth me : and whosoever shall receive me , receiveth not me , but him that sent me .
text2: " Shuar uchin winia naarui shiir awajeakka Winia shiir awajtawai . Tura Winia akuptukua nunasha shiir awajeawai " Tímiayi .

text: And John answered him , saying , Master , we saw one casting out devils in thy name , and he followeth not us : and we forbad him , because he followeth not us .
text2: Nuyá Juan Jesusan chicharuk " Uuntá , shuar ame Náarmin pachis iwianchin akupea wainkiamji . Tura iijiai írutkachu asamtai nu Túratin suritkiamji " Tímiayi .

text: But Jesus said , Forbid him not : for there is no man which shall do a miracle in my name , that can lightly speak evil of me .
text2: Tutai Jesus Tímiayi " Antsu suritkiairap . Shuar winia Náarun pachis tujinkiamun Túrakka , nu shuar wari tsanumprutratniun tujinkiattawai .

text: For he that is not against us is on our part .
text2: Shuar iin nakitramachkunka , iin Páchitkiawai , Tímiayi .

text: For whosoever shall give you a cup of water to drink in my name , because ye belong to Christ , verily I say unto you , he shall not lose his reward .
text2: Winia nemarka asakrumin shuar yumiichinkesha ajampramkuka ántar Túratsui ; akikma átatui ' Tímiayi .

text: And whosoever shall offend one of these little ones that believe in me , it is better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck , and he were cast into the sea .
text2: ` Tura shuar ju uchin Winia umirtuinia nuna yajauchin Túrumtikiamtainkia , ti asutniattawai . Tuma asamtai uchin yajauchin Túrumtiktsain kuntujen kayajai jinkiar nayaantsanam ajunmaka maak ainti .

text: And if thy hand offend thee , cut it off : it is better for thee to enter into life maimed , than having two hands to go into hell , into the fire that never shall be quenched :
text2: Ame uwejmek yajauchin Túrumtikkramamniaitkuinkia tsupikta . Mai uwejtuk Wáitsatniunam jeatniujainkia Chikichík uwejjai ju nunkanam pujusar tuke iwiaaku pujustinnium jeatin ti shiiraiti . Warí , Wáitsatniunmanka ji kajinkiashtin awai ,

text: Where their worm dieth not , and the fire is not quenched .
text2: Jákaru akarisha Jáiniatsui tura jisha tuke kapaawai .

text: And if thy foot offend thee , cut it off : it is better for thee to enter halt into life , than having two feet to be cast into hell , into the fire that never shall be quenched :
text2: Nawemsha yajauchin Túrumtikkramamniaitkuinkia nusha tsupikta . Mai nawentuk Wáitsatniunam jeatniujainkia Chikichík nawejai ju nunkanam pujusar tuke iwiaaku pujustinnium jeatin ti shiiraiti . Wáitsatniunmanka ji kajinkiashtin awai ,

text: Where their worm dieth not , and the fire is not quenched .
text2: Jákaru akarisha Jáiniatsui tura jisha tuke kapaawai .

text: And if thine eye offend thee , pluck it out : it is better for thee to enter into the kingdom of God with one eye , than having two eyes to be cast into hell fire :
text2: Jimisha yajauchin Túrumtikkramamniaitkuinkia ukuinkiata . Mai jiintiuk Wáitsatniunam jeatniujainkia Chikichík jiijiai ju nunkanam pujusar Yus akupeana nui jeatin ti shiiraiti ;

text: Where their worm dieth not , and the fire is not quenched .
text2: Wáitsatniunmanka Jákaru akarisha Jáiniatsui tura jisha tuke kapaawai .

text: For every one shall be salted with fire , and every sacrifice shall be salted with salt .
text2: Naman Yus susamu weaktinia aintsan aentstirmesha jijiai nekapnastatrume .

text: Salt is good : but if the salt have lost his saltness , wherewith will ye season it ? Have salt in yourselves , and have peace one with another .
text2: Weesha ti penkeraitiat michumarka , ṡitiurak jea - jeat átin ~ ki ? Wats , wee jeakua aintsarmek atumek shiir Enentáimtunaistarum " Tímiayi Jesus .

text: And he arose from thence , and cometh into the coasts of Judaea by the farther side of Jordan : and the people resort unto him again ; and , as he was wont , he taught them again .
text2: Jesus Kapernáumnumia jiinki , Jutía nunkanam nankaamaki , Jurtan entsa amain jeamiayi . Nui pujai , aents ataksha Niin irunturarmiayi . Iruntrarmatai tuke Túrin asa ataksha unuiniamiayi .

text: And the Pharisees came to him , and asked him , Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife ? tempting him .
text2: Tura Pariséu Jesusan nekapsatai tusar wakeruiniak , Niin chicharainiak " ṡAishman ni Nuarí ajapatin tsankamkamukait ? " tiarmiayi .

text: And he answered and said unto them , What did Moses command you ?
text2: Tutai Jesus Tímiayi " ṡMuisais wariniak timia ? "

text: And they said , Moses suffered to write a bill of divorcement , and to put her away .
text2: Tutai " Papíjiai iin ajapatniun tsankatramkamiaji " tiarmiayi .

text: And Jesus answered and said unto them , For the hardness of your heart he wrote you this precept .
text2: Tutai Jesus Tímiayi " Atumí enentai Kátsuram asamtai nu chichaman atumin tsankatramkamiarme .

text: But from the beginning of the creation God made them male and female .
text2: Tura Yus Yámankamtaik Ashí najanamia nui , aishmannasha nuwancha najanamiayi .

text: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother , and cleave to his wife ;
text2: Tuma asamtai aishman ni Aparíncha Nukuríncha kanaki ikiuki , ni nuarijiain ~ ki tsanintiniaiti .

text: And they twain shall be one flesh : so then they are no more twain , but one flesh .
text2: Warí , aishman nuarijiai Jímiaraitiat chikichik ajasartatui . Tuma asamtai Yamái Jímiarchaiti , antsu chikichik ajasuiti .

text: What therefore God hath joined together , let not man put asunder .
text2: Tuma asa , Yus atsankiania nuna , aents akankashtiniaiti " Tímiayi .

text: And in the house his disciples asked him again of the same matter .
text2: Tura urum Jeá wayawar , Jesusa unuiniamuri nu chichaman ataksha aniasarmiayi .

text: And he saith unto them , Whosoever shall put away his wife , and marry another , committeth adultery against her .
text2: Tuiniakui Jesus Tímiayi " Shuar ni nuarin ajapa ikiuak chikichan Nuátkanka , emka nuarin yajauch awajas , ikiuak , tsanirmayi .

text: And if a woman shall put away her husband , and be married to another , she committeth adultery .
text2: Nuwasha ni aishri ajapa ikiuak , chikichjai niiniurtukka , niisha tsanirmayi " Tímiayi .

text: And they brought young children to him , that he should touch them : and his disciples rebuked those that brought them .
text2: Antinkiarat tusar uchin Jesusan itiariarmiayi . Túruiniakui Jesusa unuiniamuri " itiairap " tiarmiayi .

text: But when Jesus saw it , he was much displeased , and said unto them , Suffer the little children to come unto me , and forbid them not : for of such is the kingdom of God .
text2: Tura Jesus nuna Wáiniak , kajek juna Tímiayi " Uchi Winí winitin tsankatruktarum . Suritkiairap . Iis , shuar ju uchia Núnisan peejchach Enentáimtumainia nu Yusa akupeamurin pachiinkiamniaiti .

text: Verily I say unto you , Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child , he shall not enter therein .
text2: Nuní asamtai Tájarme , uchi umiana Núnisan Yusa akupkamurin shuar Umíachkunka nuna pachiinkiachminiaiti .

text: And he took them up in his arms , put his hands upon them , and blessed them .
text2: Nuyá uchin miniakas , " Yus Yáinmakarti " Tímiayi .

text: And when he was gone forth into the way , there came one running , and kneeled to him , and asked him , Good Master , what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life ?
text2: Ukunam , Jesus Nuyá weai , shuar tseke Niin tarimiayi . Tarí tikishmatar chicharuk " ṡUuntá , Amesha ti pénkeraitme . Tuma asam , turuttia , ṡwarinia Túrakna tuke iwiaaku átataj ? " Tímiayi .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Why callest thou me good ? there is none good but one , that is , God .
text2: Tutai Jesus Tímiayi , " ṡUrukamtai Winia , pénkeraitme , Túrutam ? Shuarka chikichkisha pénkerka atsawai . Aya Yúsak pénkeraiti .

text: Thou knowest the commandments , Do not commit adultery , Do not kill , Do not steal , Do not bear false witness , Defraud not , Honour thy father and mother .
text2: Yus akupkamu nékatsmek . Ju ainiawai : tsanirmawairap , mankartuawairap , kasamkairap , Chíkich shuar tsanumprurairap , anankartuawairap , apasha nukusha umirkatarum . Nu ainiawai " Tímiayi .

text: And he answered and said unto him , Master , all these have I observed from my youth .
text2: Tutai Kuítrintin chichaak " Uunta , Núnaka úchichik mash umiki tsakaruitjai " Tímiayi .

text: Then Jesus beholding him loved him , and said unto him , One thing thou lackest : go thy way , sell whatsoever thou hast , and give to the poor , and thou shalt have treasure in heaven : and come , take up the cross , and follow me .
text2: Tutai Jesus iis waitnenmai Tímiayi " Chikichik Táasume . Weme Ashí áminiu ana nu surukta . Túram nu kuit Kuítrincha susarta . Túrakum nayaimpiniam Kuítrum ikiaunkattme . Túram winitia , krus yanaktinia aintsamek itiurchatrum ain nemartusta " Tímiayi .

text: And he was sad at that saying , and went away grieved : for he had great possessions .
text2: Tura Kuítrintin nu chichaman antuk , wake mesek , Kúntuts Enentáimiar wémiayi , ti kuitrintin asa .

text: And Jesus looked round about , and saith unto his disciples , How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God !
text2: Nii wématai , Jesus Ashí ni téntakmarin iis , ni unuiniamurin chicharuk , " Kuítrintin ainia nu Yusa akupeamurin pachiinkiatin ti itiurchataiti " Tímiayi .

text: And the disciples were astonished at his words . But Jesus answereth again , and saith unto them , Children , how hard is it for them that trust in riches to enter into the kingdom of God !
text2: Takui ni unuiniamuri nuna antukar Niisháa Enentáimprarmiayi . Túramtai Jesus Tímiayi " Uchiru antuktarum . Shuar Kuítriniak Enentáimtuinia nuka , Yusa akupeamurin pachiinkiatin penké itiurchataiti .

text: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle , than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God .
text2: Uunt kamiriu auja jiin wayatin ana Nú nankaamas , Kuítrintin Yusa akupeamurin pachiinkiatin itiurchataiti " Tímiayi .

text: And they were astonished out of measure , saying among themselves , Who then can be saved ?
text2: Nuna antukar Nú arant Niisháa Enentáimprarmiayi . " ṡNuinkia yaki uwempramniait ? " tunaiyarmiayi .

text: And Jesus looking upon them saith , With men it is impossible , but not with God : for with God all things are possible .
text2: Tura Jesus niin iisar chichainiak " Aents ninki Túrachminiaiti , antsu Yus Túramniaiti . Yuska Ashí Túramniaiti " Tímiayi .

text: Then Peter began to say unto him , Lo , we have left all , and have followed thee .
text2: Nuyá Pítiur Niin chicharuk " Iis , iikia Ashí ikiukir némartsujik " Tímiayi .

text: And Jesus answered and said , Verily I say unto you , There is no man that hath left house , or brethren , or sisters , or father , or mother , or wife , or children , or lands , for my sake , and the gospel ' s ,
text2: Tutai Jesussha Tímiayi , " Nekas Tájarme , shuar Winia nemartak Yus - Chichamnasha ipiampartasa wakerak ni jeencha , yachincha , umaincha , Aparíncha , Nukuríncha , nuarincha , Uchiríncha , nunkencha uyumatsuk ikiuakka ,

text: But he shall receive an hundredfold now in this time , houses , and brethren , and sisters , and mothers , and children , and lands , with persecutions ; and in the world to come eternal life .
text2: nu shuar ju nunkanam sian patatnas jeencha , yachincha , umaincha , Nukuríncha , Uchiríncha , nunkencha , ju nunkanam Wáitiayat sunastatui . Tura ukunam , nunka amuukamtai , nu shuarsha Jáchatainium tuke pénker pujustatui .

text: But many that are first shall be last ; and the last first .
text2: Tura Untsurí shuar Yamái penkeri ainia nu , ukunam ukunmaani pujusartatui , tura iiksan Untsurí shuar Yamái ukunmaya ainia nu , ukunam eem pujusartatui " Tímiayi Jesus .

text: And they were in the way going up to Jerusalem ; and Jesus went before them : and they were amazed ; and as they followed , they were afraid . And he took again the twelve , and began to tell them what things should happen unto him ,
text2: Nuyá arak Jerusarénnum wéenak , jintiak wearmiayi . Jesuska émak wémiayi . Ni unuiniamurisha Niisháa Enentáimprarmiayi . Ashamainiayatan Jesusan nemarsarmiayi . Túmainiai atak ni nekas unuiniamurin akankiar , ni Túrunatniurin ujakmiayi .

text: Saying , Behold , we go up to Jerusalem ; and the Son of man shall be delivered unto the chief priests , and unto the scribes ; and they shall condemn him to death , and shall deliver him to the Gentiles :
text2: Ujaak Tímiayi " Antuktarum , arak Jerusarénnum wéaji . Nui Winia , Aents Ajasuitjiana juna , Patri uuntriincha , jintinniunmasha surutkartatui . Niisha apachnium mantamnati tusar surutkartatui .

text: And they shall mock him , and shall scourge him , and shall spit upon him , and shall kill him : and the third day he shall rise again .
text2: Nusha Winia wishikrurar , katsumprukar , usukruawar mantuawartatui . Túramaitiatnak Menaintiú tsawantai nantaktiatjai " Tímiayi .

text: And James and John , the sons of Zebedee , come unto him , saying , Master , we would that thou shouldest do for us whatsoever we shall desire .
text2: Sepetéu Uchirí Jakupusha Juansha Jesusan taruntarmiayi . Taruntar " Uuntá , ii seattajnia nu Túrak tusar wakeraji " tiarmiayi .

text: And he said unto them , What would ye that I should do for you ?
text2: Tutai Jesus Tímiayi " ṡWarí itiurtukat tusam wakerutam ? "

text: They said unto him , Grant unto us that we may sit , one on thy right hand , and the other on thy left hand , in thy glory .
text2: Tutai " Ame nupetmaktin tsawantrum jeamtai , iisha Amijiai pujustaitsar wakeraji , wi untsuurumini , winia yatsursha menaarmini . Nu tsankatrukta " Tíarmiayi .

text: But Jesus said unto them , Ye know not what ye ask : can ye drink of the cup that I drink of ? and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with ?
text2: Tura Jesus Tímiayi " Atum seatrumna nu nékatsrume . Wi umartatjana nu umarminkaitrum . Tura Wi imiantiatjana Núnisrum imianminkaitrum " Tímiayi .

text: And they said unto him , We can . And Jesus said unto them , Ye shall indeed drink of the cup that I drink of ; and with the baptism that I am baptized withal shall ye be baptized :
text2: Niisha tiarmiayi , " Túramniaitji , Páchitskea . " Tuíniakui Jesus Tímiayi " Wats , Wi umartatjana nu umartatrume , tura Wi imiantiatjana Núnisrumek imiantiatrume .

text: But to sit on my right hand and on my left hand is not mine to give ; but it shall be given to them for whom it is prepared .
text2: Túrasha winia untsuuruini , menaruinisha átum pujustinian Wikia Súsashtiniaitjarme , antsu Yus wakerana nu nuin apujsattawai " Tímiayi .

text: And when the ten heard it , they began to be much displeased with James and John .
text2: Tura Chíkich tias unuiniamuri nuna anturkar Jakupuncha , Juánnasha ti kajerkarmiayi .

text: But Jesus called them to him , and saith unto them , Ye know that they which are accounted to rule over the Gentiles exercise lordship over them ; and their great ones exercise authority upon them .
text2: Tura Jesus ni unuiniamurin irur Tímiayi " Ju nékarme ; Yus - shuarchanum akupniuitjai tuinia nu , waantu Enentáimtumas , ni Shuárin ti akupeawai ; tura uunt ainia nusha Ashí shuar ti takamtikiainiawai .

text: But so shall it not be among you : but whosoever will be great among you , shall be your minister :
text2: Antsu atumjai Núnisan atsutniuiti . Atumka , wi unuiniamutiram , uunt ajastaj tusarum wakerakrumka , Ashí Yáimin ajastiniaitrume .

text: And whosoever of you will be the chiefest , shall be servant of all .
text2: Shuar Atumí penkeri ajastajtsa wakerakka , takarniua nuke ajas , Umirtamkatí .

text: For even the Son of man came not to be ministered unto , but to minister , and to give his life a ransom for many .
text2: Wisha , Aents Ajasuitjiana ju , shuar takartusarat tusan Táchamjai , antsu Ashí Shuáran Yáintaj tusan Táwitjai . Wisha jarukan Shuáran uwemtikratajtsan Táwitjai " Tímiayi .

text: And they came to Jericho : and as he went out of Jericho with his disciples and a great number of people , blind Bartimaeus , the son of Timaeus , sat by the highway side begging .
text2: Jesus ni unuiniamurijiai , tura Chíkich Untsurí aentsjai Jirikiú péprunam jeawarmiayi . Nuyá Jirikiúnmayasha Jíinkiar weenai , Timiasa Uchirí Partimiás , kusuru amia nu , Jintiá yantam Kuítian seamu pujumiayi .

text: And when he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth , he began to cry out , and say , Jesus , thou Son of David , have mercy on me .
text2: Niisha , Nasarétnumia Jesusaiti Táman antuk , untsumuk " Uunt Jesusa , amesha Uunt Akupin Tawit weeachukaitiam , Yus anaikiachmakaitiam . Winiaja waitnentrurta " Tímiayi .

text: And many charged him that he should hold his peace : but he cried the more a great deal , Thou Son of David , have mercy on me .
text2: Tura Untsurí nui matsamarmia nu niin chicharainiak " Takamatsata " tiarmiayi . Niisha Nú nankaamas untsummiayi " Tawit Weeá Jesusá , winia waitnentrurta . "

text: And Jesus stood still , and commanded him to be called . And they call the blind man , saying unto him , Be of good comfort , rise ; he calleth thee .
text2: Nuna antuk Jesus wajatas , chichaak " Untsuktarum " Tímiayi . Takui shuar kusurun untsuiniak " Kakaram ajasta . Wajaktia ; untsurmawai " tiarmiayi .

text: And he , casting away his garment , rose , and came to Jesus .
text2: Tuiniakui niisha esekmatairin ajapa ikiuak wajaki Jesusan tseke tarimiayi .

text: And Jesus answered and said unto him , What wilt thou that I should do unto thee ? The blind man said unto him , Lord , that I might receive my sight .
text2: Tura Jesus niin chicharuk " ṡWinia itiurtukat tusamea wakerutam ? " Tímiayi . Tutai kusuru chicharuk " Uunta , iimtiasan wakerajai " Tímiayi .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Go thy way ; thy faith hath made thee whole . And immediately he received his sight , and followed Jesus in the way .
text2: Tutai Jesus chichaak " Shiir Wetá . Winia nekas Enentáimtursa asam pénker ajasume " Tímiayi . Tura nu chichamaik iimpramiayi . Tura Jesusan nemarki wémiayi .

text: And when they came nigh to Jerusalem , unto Bethphage and Bethany , at the mount of Olives , he sendeth forth two of his disciples ,
text2: Wésar Jerusarénnum tura Petpajái péprusha Petania péprusha Uriwiu naint ínkiuasmak ámanum jeawar , Jesus Jimiará unuiniamurin ujuikimiayi .

text: And saith unto them , Go your way into the village over against you : and as soon as ye be entered into it , ye shall find a colt tied , whereon never man sat ; loose him , and bring him .
text2: Ujuiak Tímiayi " Aatunini pépruchiniam werum nuin umpuuru uchich jinkiamu Wáinkiattarme . Nu umpuuruka tuke entsamprukchamuiti . Nu atiarum utitiarum .

text: And if any man say unto you , Why do ye this ? say ye that the Lord hath need of him ; and straightway he will send him hither .
text2: Tura " ṡUrukamtia aitkiarum ? " turamainiakuisha , " ii Uuntri wakerawai " titiarum " Tímiayi .

text: And they went their way , and found the colt tied by the door without in a place where two ways met ; and they loose him .
text2: Tutai wearmiayi . Tura umpuurun Wáitiniam aani jinkiamun , Jintiá yantamnum wajan Wáinkiar atiawarmiayi .

text: And certain of them that stood there said unto them , What do ye , loosing the colt ?
text2: Nui pujuarmia nu " ṡWarí aitkiarum . Urukamtai umpuuru Atíarum ? " tiarmiayi .

text: And they said unto them even as Jesus had commanded : and they let them go .
text2: Takui , niisha Jesus timia nu ujakam suritkiacharmiayi .

text: And they brought the colt to Jesus , and cast their garments on him ; and he sat upon him .
text2: Tura umpuurun Jesusan itiariar pushirin umpuurunam awantkarmiayi . Túram Jesus entsamkamiayi .

text: And many spread their garments in the way : and others cut down branches off the trees , and strawed them in the way .
text2: Tura Untsurí shuarsha pushirin jintianam ayapar ainkiarmiayi . Chíkichcha Jintiá yantamnumian nukan juuk jintianam aintrarmiayi .

text: And they that went before , and they that followed , cried , saying , Hosanna ; Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord :
text2: Eem wearmia nusha , uku winiarmia nusha warainiak " Jusanna " untsumkarmiayi . " Yusa Náaríin winiana nu Imiá pénkeraiti .

text: Blessed be the kingdom of our father David , that cometh in the name of the Lord : Hosanna in the highest .
text2: Ii uuntri Tawitia akupeamuri Tátatna nu Imiá penker Atí . Ii Yusri naari shiir ati . " Tu untsumki wearmiayi .

text: And Jesus entered into Jerusalem , and into the temple : and when he had looked round about upon all things , and now the eventide was come , he went out unto Bethany with the twelve .
text2: Tura Jesus Jerusarénnum jeamiayi . Jeá , Yusa Uunt Jeen wayamiayi . Tura Ashí iiyasua amik , kintiampraij tusa ni tuse unuiniamurijiai Tíjiuch Petania péprunam wearmiayi .

text: And on the morrow , when they were come from Bethany , he was hungry :
text2: Kashin tsawar , Petanianmaya jintia wesa , Jesus tsukammiayi .

text: And seeing a fig tree afar off having leaves , he came , if haply he might find any thing thereon : and when he came to it , he found nothing but leaves ; for the time of figs was not yet .
text2: Tura arant wajan iikiu numirin Núkenniun Wáiniak , nereatsuash tusa iyumiayi . Tura nereshtairin asamtai neren penké Wáinkiachmiayi .

text: And Jesus answered and said unto it , No man eat fruit of thee hereafter for ever . And his disciples heard it .
text2: Nuyá iikiu numin yuminkeak : " Ame nerem penké yunaashti " Tímiayi . Ni unuiniamurisha nuna Táman antukarmiayi .

text: And they come to Jerusalem : and Jesus went into the temple , and began to cast out them that sold and bought in the temple , and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers , and the seats of them that sold doves ;
text2: Nuyá atak Jerusarénnum jeawarmiayi . Nui Jesus Yusa Uunt Jeen Wayá suruktai tusar pujuarmia nuna jiiki akupkatasa nankammiayi . Kuítian yapajin armia nuna misarin tura yampitsan Súrin armia nuna kutankrincha ayanturmiayi .

text: And would not suffer that any man should carry any vessel through the temple .
text2: Tura Káarak entsaki Yusa Uunt Jeen nankaamaktinian suritkiarmiayi .

text: And he taught , saying unto them , Is it not written , My house shall be called of all nations the house of prayer ? but ye have made it a den of thieves .
text2: Nuyá " Yus áujsatai tusar Ashí shuar Yusa jeen wayamnia átatui " Tú aarchamukait Yusa Papiriin . Antsu átumka Yusa jee kasa matsamtaiya Nútikiarme " Tímiayi .

text: And the scribes and chief priests heard it , and sought how they might destroy him : for they feared him , because all the people was astonished at his doctrine .
text2: Aents nui matsamarmia nu Jesusa chichamen antukar ti Enentáimprarmiayi . Tuma asamtai Israer - patri uuntrisha , Israer - shuara jintinniurisha , nuna nekaawar , Jesusan ashamainiak mantamnati tusar chichaman jurusarmiayi .

text: And when even was come , he went out of the city .
text2: Nuyá kiakui Jesus Jerusarénnumia jiinkimiayi .

text: And in the morning , as they passed by , they saw the fig tree dried up from the roots .
text2: Kashin Káshik nankaamainiak iikiu numin kankaptuk jaka wajan Wáinkiarmiayi .

text: And Peter calling to remembrance saith unto him , Master , behold , the fig tree which thou cursedst is withered away .
text2: Tura Pítiur Enentáimias Jesusan Tímiayi " Uunta , iista , iikiu Ame yuminkramam nu kankaptuk Káarchaik . "

text: And Jesus answering saith unto them , Have faith in God .
text2: Tutai Jesus Tímiayi " Yus nekas Enentáimtustarum .

text: For verily I say unto you , That whosoever shall say unto this mountain , Be thou removed , and be thou cast into the sea ; and shall not doubt in his heart , but shall believe that those things which he saith shall come to pass ; he shall have whatsoever he saith .
text2: Iis , nekas Tátsujrumek , shuar " Yus nekas Túratpiash " Tútsuk , tura " wi Tájana nuna Yus nekas Túrattawai " tu Enentáimsar , ju Náintian " jiinki nayaantsanam Iniántí " Tákuinkia , Páchitsuk iniantatui , Tímiayi .

text: Therefore I say unto you , What things soever ye desire , when ye pray , believe that ye receive them , and ye shall have them .
text2: Tuma asamtai Tájarme , Ashí Yus áujkuram searmena nuna suramsattarme . " Wi seajna nuna Yamái takakjai " tu Enentáimkiurmeka , Wáinkiáttarme .

text: And when ye stand praying , forgive , if ye have ought against any : that your Father also which is in heaven may forgive you your trespasses .
text2: Tura Yus áujkuram pujarmena nu , kajernaiyamuram ákuinkia Tsankurnáiratarum . Atumí Aparí nayaimpiniam pujana nu Atumí tunaarin tsankurturti tusarum Túratarum .

text: But if ye do not forgive , neither will your Father which is in heaven forgive your trespasses .
text2: Atumsha Tsankurnáiyachkurminkia , Núnisan Atumí Aparí nayaimpiniam pujana nu Atumí tunaarin Tsankurtámprashtatrume " Tímiayi Jesus .

text: And they come again to Jerusalem : and as he was walking in the temple , there come to him the chief priests , and the scribes , and the elders ,
text2: Ataksha Jerusarénnum waketkiarmiayi . Jesus Yusa Uunt Jeen wekai , Israer - patri uuntrisha , Israer - shuara jintinniurisha , Israer - shuara iruntai - jee uuntrisha Niin Káutkarmiayi .

text: And say unto him , By what authority doest thou these things ? and who gave thee this authority to do these things ?
text2: Káutkar Jesusan tiarmiayi " ṡYana kakarmarijiai ju Túram . Ame Túramna nuna ya tsankatrama ? " tiarmiayi .

text: And Jesus answered and said unto them , I will also ask of you one question , and answer me , and I will tell you by what authority I do these things .
text2: Tuiniakui Jesus Tímiayi , " Chikichkiniak aniastatjarme . Airkatarum . Túrakrumninkia Wisha winia takastinian tsankatrukmia nuna ujaktatjarme .

text: The baptism of John , was it from heaven , or of men ? answer me .
text2: Wats , turutiarum , ṡya Juan imiaitniun tsankatkama ? ṡShuar tsankatkamka ? ṡYus tsankatkamka ? Airkatarum " Tímiayi .

text: And they reasoned with themselves , saying , If we shall say , From heaven ; he will say , Why then did ye not believe him ?
text2: Tura niisha Enentáimprar " Yus akupkaiti " Tákurninkia , " ṡurukamtia umirkachuram ? " turamchattajik .

text: But if we shall say , Of men ; they feared the people : for all men counted John , that he was a prophet indeed .
text2: Antsu " shuar tsankatkaiti " Tákurkia , Ashí shuar ashamaji " tunainiarmiayi . Ashí aents Juan nekas Yúsnan etserniuiti , tu Enentáimainiakui ashammiarmiayi .

text: And they answered and said unto Jesus , We cannot tell . And Jesus answering saith unto them , Neither do I tell you by what authority I do these things .
text2: Nuyá Jesusan tiarmiayi " Iikia nékatsji . " Tutai Jesus Tímiayi " Wisha Núnisnak yana kakarmarijiai takaaj nuna ujakchattajrume . "

text: And he began to speak unto them by parables . A certain man planted a vineyard , and set an hedge about it , and digged a place for the winefat , and built a tower , and let it out to husbandmen , and went into a far country .
text2: Jesus ju métek - taku chichaman unuiniamiayi : " Shuar uwa ajan ajam wenuimiai . Nuyá uwa nekeetain najanamai . Tura kumpin jean najanamai . Najana takartusti tusa Shuáran ikiuak ninkia jeachat wémai .

text: And at the season he sent to the husbandmen a servant , that he might receive from the husbandmen of the fruit of the vineyard .
text2: Neretai tsawant jeamtai , ni takarniurin Júukman akankat tusa akupkamai .

text: And they caught him , and beat him , and sent him away empty .
text2: Tura ajanam takau arma nu , nu takarniun achik , katsumkar , áyatik awainkiarmai .
