text: When thou art bidden of any man to a wedding , sit not down in the highest room ; lest a more honourable man than thou be bidden of him ;
text2: " Nuátnaikiatin nampernum penkeri pujutainium pujusaip . Nui pujakminkia , Chíkich ámijiai nankaamas penkéri Táchatpiash . '

text: And he that bade thee and him come and say to thee , Give this man place ; and thou begin with shame to take the lowest room .
text2: ` Tura ipiatmania nu chichartamuk " Chikich iiktusta " turamchatpiash . Nuinkia Chíkich Nánkatkamu pujutainium wéakum natsartatme .

text: But when thou art bidden , go and sit down in the lowest room ; that when he that bade thee cometh , he may say unto thee , Friend , go up higher : then shalt thou have worship in the presence of them that sit at meat with thee .
text2: Antsu ipiatmakmin , Nánkatkamu pujutainium Pujustá . Nuinkia ipiatmamnia nu chichartamuk " Amikru , ámeka jui penkeri pujutainium Pujustá " turamtatui . Nujai Chíkich ipiaamu ainia nu , " nekas penkerinti " turamartatui .

text: For whosoever exalteth himself shall be abased ; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted .
text2: Iimiata , " penkerintjai " tu Enentáimtuma nuka péejchach awajnastatui . Tura ímianchach Enentáimtúmana nuka waantu ajastiniaiti . "

text: Then said he also to him that bade him , When thou makest a dinner or a supper , call not thy friends , nor thy brethren , neither thy kinsmen , nor thy rich neighbours ; lest they also bid thee again , and a recompence be made thee .
text2: Nuyá Niin ipiaamua nuna chicharuk Tímiayi " Amesha Yurumáití tusam untsuktajtsam wakerakmeka , ame amikrumsha , yatsumsha , ame shuarumsha , írutramuram Kuítrintin ainia nusha ipiaawaip . Nii ipiaamka , ataksha íksan ámin ipiatmashtatuak . Nujai akikma átatme .

text: But when thou makest a feast , call the poor , the maimed , the lame , the blind :
text2: Antsu Yurumáití tusam untsuktajtsam wakerakmeka , Kuítrincha , wekaicha , shutuapsha , kusurusha ipiaawarta .

text: And thou shalt be blessed ; for they cannot recompense thee : for thou shalt be recompensed at the resurrection of the just .
text2: Niisha akirmaktinian tujintiainiawai . Pénker shuar nantakiartatna nui akinkiattame . Nu tuma asamtai warastatme " Tímiayi .

text: And when one of them that sat at meat with him heard these things , he said unto him , Blessed is he that shall eat bread in the kingdom of God .
text2: Nu misanam pujuarmia nuya , chikichik Jesus chichaamun antuk , Jesusan Tímiayi " Yus akupeamunam pachiiniak , yurumkunka ti shiir ainti . "

text: Then said he unto him , A certain man made a great supper , and bade many :
text2: Nuna takui Jesus juna jintintiamiayi : " Aishman namperan Nájanuk , Untsurí shuaran Taartí tusa akatar akupkamai .

text: And sent his servant at supper time to say to them that were bidden , Come ; for all things are now ready .
text2: Yurumátin jeamtai " Winitiarum , Yurumátin jeayi " tu tiarta tusa ni takarniurin akupkamai .

text: And they all with one consent began to make excuse . The first said unto him , I have bought a piece of ground , and I must needs go and see it : I pray thee have me excused .
text2: Tura winichminiaitji tusar Ashí ujakarmai . Chíkich timiai " Nunkan Yamái sumarmakjai . Iyutaj tusa wéakun winishtatjai . Tsankurturti " timiai .

text: And another said , I have bought five yoke of oxen , and I go to prove them : I pray thee have me excused .
text2: Tura Chíkich chichaak " Wisha tias waakan sumarmakjai . Nekapsatsan wakerajai . Tuma asan winishtatjai . Tsankurturti " timiai .

text: And another said , I have married a wife , and therefore I cannot come .
text2: Tura Chíkich chichaak " Yamái nuatnaikiajai . Tuma asan winishtatjai " timiai .

text: So that servant came , and shewed his lord these things . Then the master of the house being angry said to his servant , Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city , and bring in hither the poor , and the maimed , and the halt , and the blind .
text2: Takarin waketki ni uuntrin Ashí nuna ujakmai . Nuna antuk niisha kajekmiayi . Tura ni takarniurin timiai " Ju péprunam pénker jintianmasha tura uchich jintiachinmasha weme , Kuítrincha tura wekaichasha , shutuapsha , kusurusha itiaarta . "

text: And the servant said , Lord , it is done as thou hast commanded , and yet there is room .
text2: Nuyá ukunam ni takarniuri taa chicharuk " Uuntá , ame turutmiamna Nútiksanak Túramjai ; Túrasha tuke ankant awai " timiai . '

text: And the lord said unto the servant , Go out into the highways and hedges , and compel them to come in , that my house may be filled .
text2: ` Tutai ni uuntri chichaak " Jintianam weme , Chíkich jintiachiniam weme , Wáinmena nu Ashí awayawarta . Winia jearui piakat tusan wakerajai .

text: For I say unto you , That none of those men which were bidden shall taste of my supper .
text2: Emka ipiaawarmajnia nuka penké Chikichkíksha wininkia Yurumáchartatui , tajarme ' Tímiayi . "

text: And there went great multitudes with him : and he turned , and said unto them ,
text2: Untsurí aents Jesusjai irunki wearmiayi . Niisha nuna apajas iis juna Tímiayi :

text: If any man come to me , and hate not his father , and mother , and wife , and children , and brethren , and sisters , yea , and his own life also , he cannot be my disciple .
text2: " Shuar ni Aparíncha , ni Nukuríncha , Nuaríncha Uchiríncha , yachincha , umaincha Wijiai nankaamas Enentáimtakka , tura shiir pujustinian wakerak Winí winitniun nakitiakka winia unuiniamur ajaschamniaiti .

text: And whosoever doth not bear his cross , and come after me , cannot be my disciple .
text2: Ni wakeramurin ajakeak ni krusri yanaki nemartatsna nu winia unuiniamur ajaschamniaiti . '

text: For which of you , intending to build a tower , sitteth not down first , and counteth the cost , whether he have sufficient to finish it ?
text2: ` Jea Yakí jeamtaj tusam wakerakmeka , Kuítian urutmak ajapawaintiaj tusam tura urutmajain ~ ki amukaintiaj tusam emka Enentáimsashtatmek .

text: Lest haply , after he hath laid the foundation , and is not able to finish it , all that behold it begin to mock him ,
text2: Túrutsuk aya ukura iniaisam amuktin tujinkiakminkia , nuna Wáiniainia nu , wishikiainiak juna tiartatui :

text: Saying , This man began to build , and was not able to finish .
text2: " Iiskua . Nu shuar jeamtinian nankamamiayi . Túrasha amuktinian tujinkiamiayi . " '

text: Or what king , going to make war against another king , sitteth not down first , and consulteth whether he be able with ten thousand to meet him that cometh against him with twenty thousand ?
text2: ` Tura uunt Kapitián Chíkich Kapitiánjai mesetan najanatin áchatpiash . Emka , niisha pujus , tias mir ( 10 . 000 ) suntarjai painti mir ( 20 . 000 ) suntar winiana nuna nupetkaintjash tusa Enentáimsashtatuak .

text: Or else , while the other is yet a great way off , he sendeth an ambassage , and desireth conditions of peace .
text2: Tujintiakka , Chíkich Kapitián jeachat pujaanak , nawamnaikiatai tusa akatar akupkashtatuak .

text: So likewise , whosoever he be of you that forsaketh not all that he hath , he cannot be my disciple .
text2: Wats , " Kristu unuiniamuri ajastinjai , wi takakjana juna Warí winia itiurtawa " tu Enentáimsatniuitrume . Túrachkurmeka winia unuiniamur ajastin tujinkiarme . '

text: Salt is good : but if the salt have lost his savour , wherewith shall it be seasoned ?
text2: ` Weeka jeaku pénkeraiti . Tura michumarka ṡitiurak atak pénker ati ?

text: It is neither fit for the land , nor yet for the dunghill ; but men cast it out . He that hath ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Wee michumarka araakmatniunmasha yayaatsui . Tura tsuatnum ikiusmasha ántraiti . Aya ajapatniukete . Kuishim ákuinkia antuktarum " Tímiayi .

text: Then drew near unto him all the publicans and sinners for to hear him .
text2: Akupniu Kuítrin - juu tura yajauch shuarsha Jesusan anturkatai tusar Tarú wearmiayi .

text: And the Pharisees and scribes murmured , saying , This man receiveth sinners , and eateth with them .
text2: Tuma asamtai Pariséusha , Israer - shuara jintinniurisha Jesusan áujmatainiak " Jusha Tunáa shuaran itiaawai tura niijiai Yurumáiniawai " tiarmiayi .

text: And he spake this parable unto them , saying ,
text2: Nuna tuiniakui Jesus ju métek - taku chichaman jintintiawarmiayi :

text: What man of you , having an hundred sheep , if he lose one of them , doth not leave the ninety and nine in the wilderness , and go after that which is lost , until he find it ?
text2: " Shuar sian ( 100 ) murikiun takuschampiash . Nu Siánnumia chikichik menkakamtai nuwintia Nuíwinkia ni matsatmariin ikiuak , menkaka nuna ti eakchattawak . Wáintsuk iniaisashtatui .

text: And when he hath found it , he layeth it on his shoulders , rejoicing .
text2: Tura Wáiniak yakainium awankek waras jeen Wáketui .

text: And when he cometh home , he calleth together his friends and neighbours , saying unto them , Rejoice with me ; for I have found my sheep which was lost .
text2: Tura jeen Jeá ni amikrin , írutramurincha ikiaanak " Wijiai warastarum . Murikiur menkaka nuna Wáinkiajai " tawai .

text: I say unto you , that likewise joy shall be in heaven over one sinner that repenteth , more than over ninety and nine just persons , which need no repentance .
text2: Wats , nuwintia nuiwi pénker shuar akui nayaimpiniam warastin awai . Tura antsu Chikichík yajauch shuar ni Enentáin Yapajiámtainkia , Nú nankaamas warastin átatui , Tájarme ' Tímiayi .

text: Either what woman having ten pieces of silver , if she lose one piece , doth not light a candle , and sweep the house , and seek diligently till she find it ?
text2: ` Nuyá Chíkich Enentáimsatai . Nuwa tias Kuítian takakna nuna chikichik menkakamtai , Wáinkiataj tusa jinia ekeemak , jean japimiak émamkes eakchattawak .

text: And when she hath found it , she calleth her friends and her neighbours together , saying , Rejoice with me ; for I have found the piece which I had lost .
text2: Tura Wáiniak ni amikrin , írutramurincha ikiaanak , " Wijiai warastarum . Kuit menkakamia nuna Wáinkiajai " tawai .

text: Likewise , I say unto you , there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner that repenteth .
text2: Núnisan yajauch shuar ni Enentáin Yapajiámtai , Yusa suntari matsatmanum ti warastin awai " Tímiayi .

text: And he said , A certain man had two sons :
text2: Nuyá Jesus juna unuiniamiayi : " Aishman Jimiará uchin takakuyi .

text: And the younger of them said to his father , Father , give me the portion of goods that falleth to me . And he divided unto them his living .
text2: Tura Pátatka uchi ni Aparín timiai " Apawá , surustiniaitmena nu Yamái surusta . " ' ` Tutai ni Aparí ni Kuítrin Jímiapetek nakak mai uchin susamai .

text: And not many days after the younger son gathered all together , and took his journey into a far country , and there wasted his substance with riotous living .
text2: Ishichik tsawant nankaamasai Pátatka uchi ni waririn irur Jukí jeachat Chíkich Núnkanam wémai . Nuisha Nánkamas yajauchin Túrak Kuítrin Ashí ajapamai .

text: And when he had spent all , there arose a mighty famine in that land ; and he began to be in want .
text2: Ni kuitri Ashí amuuka ain nu nunkanam ti tsuka ámai . Niisha Núnisan tsukariin Wáitsamai .

text: And he went and joined himself to a citizen of that country ; and he sent him into his fields to feed swine .
text2: Túmak takatan eaktajtsa nu nunkanmaya apachiin werimiai . Nu aishmansha kuchirin Wáitrukta tusa akupkamai .

text: And he would fain have filled his belly with the husks that the swine did eat : and no man gave unto him .
text2: Uchi ti tsukamak kuchi ukatramun niisha Yuátajtsa ti wakerimiai . Túrasha penké Súcharmai .

text: And when he came to himself , he said , How many hired servants of my father ' s have bread enough and to spare , and I perish with hunger !
text2: Tumáa pujus nuinkia Enentáimpramai . " Winia Aparuí takau shuar pénkeran ti Yurumáiniawai . Tura wikia jui tsukarui Wáitiajai .

text: I will arise and go to my father , and will say unto him , Father , I have sinned against heaven , and before thee ,
text2: Wats , Aparuí waketkitjai . Tura aparun chicharkun " Apawá Yúsjaisha ámijiaisha tunaan Túrajai , titiajai .

text: And am no more worthy to be called thy son : make me as one of thy hired servants .
text2: Ame uchiram áchamniaitjai yamaikia . Ame takarniurmea aantsanak átaj tusan wakerajai " titiajai " tu Enentáimsamai .

text: And he arose , and came to his father . But when he was yet a great way off , his father saw him , and had compassion , and ran , and fell on his neck , and kissed him .
text2: Tura wajaki ni apariin waketkimiai ' Tímiayi . ` Tura ni Aparísha jeachat winian Wáiniak waitnentramai . Aparí tsékenki inkiun miniakak Mukunámai .

text: And the son said unto him , Father , I have sinned against heaven , and in thy sight , and am no more worthy to be called thy son .
text2: Nuinkia Uchirísha timiai " Apawá , Yúsjaisha ámijiaisha Tunáan Túrajai . Ame uchiram áchamniaitjai . " '

text: But the father said to his servants , Bring forth the best robe , and put it on him ; and put a ring on his hand , and shoes on his feet :
text2: ` Túrasha ni Aparínkia ni takarniurin chicharuk " Ti penker Pushí itiarum aentsratarum , timiai . Tura uwejnum aweetaisha aweemtikiatarum . Tura sapatcha aweemtikiatarum .

text: And bring hither the fatted calf , and kill it ; and let us eat , and be merry :
text2: Túrarum waaka nueram ana nu maatarum . Námper Nájankur shiir Enentáimsar Yurumámi .

text: For this my son was dead , and is alive again ; he was lost , and is found . And they began to be merry .
text2: Warí , ju winia uchir jakaapitia tu Enentáimsamjai . Túrasha iwiaakui . Menkakama nuna Wáinkiajai . " Nuinkia ti warasarmai ' Tímiayi .

text: Now his elder son was in the field : and as he came and drew nigh to the house , he heard musick and dancing .
text2: ` Tumai Iwiái úchikia takatnum pujumai . Tura Wáketuk , Jeá nuntumas Jantsemáiniak Túntuiyamun antukmai .

text: And he called one of the servants , and asked what these things meant .
text2: Nuinkia yaintri matsatun chikichkiniak untsuk " ṡWarimpait ? " timiai . '

text: And he said unto him , Thy brother is come ; and thy father hath killed the fatted calf , because he hath received him safe and sound .
text2: ` Tura nii chichaak " Ame Yátsum tayi . Túramtai ame apa waaka nueram maatai tawai , ame yatsum pénker tau asamtai " timiai . '

text: And he was angry , and would not go in : therefore came his father out , and intreated him .
text2: ` Tura iwiai uchi kajek wayatniun nakitramai . ' ` Tuma asamtai ni Aparí jiintiuki " wayata " timiai . '

text: And he answering said to his father , Lo , these many years do I serve thee , neither transgressed I at any time thy commandment : and yet thou never gavest me a kid , that I might make merry with my friends :
text2: ` Tura uchisha Aparín chicharuk " Wisha ámin umirkun Untsurí uwitin ame takatrumin Túraitjai . Nu nékame . Túrasha winia amikrujai Námper najanatin chiipiuksha penké surichuitme .

text: But as soon as this thy son was come , which hath devoured thy living with harlots , thou hast killed for him the fatted calf .
text2: Tura ju ame uchiram nuwajai yajauchin Túrak ame Kuítrumin wasurkania nu Támatai , waaka nueram Máachumek " timiai . '

text: And he said unto him , Son , thou art ever with me , and all that I have is thine .
text2: ` Takui Aparí chicharuk " Uchirú , ámeka wijiai tuke pujame . Tura wi takakjana nusha Ashí áminuiti .

text: It was meet that we should make merry , and be glad : for this thy brother was dead , and is alive again ; and was lost , and is found .
text2: Tura ame yatsum Jákaiti tu Enentáimsamiaj nu iwiaakuiti . Menkaka nu yamaikia Wáinkiaji . Tuma asamtai Námper najanar waraschatniukaitiaj ~ i " timiai " Tímiayi .

text: And he said also unto his disciples , There was a certain rich man , which had a steward ; and the same was accused unto him that he had wasted his goods .
text2: Ju métek - taku chichamnasha Jesus ni unuiniamurin unuiniamiayi . " Kuítrintin aishmanka takatrin Wáinniuri ámai . Tura nérenniun ujainiak " Ame Wáinniuram ame Kuítrumin Nánkamas ajapeawai " tiarmai . '

text: And he called him , and said unto him , How is it that I hear this of thee ? give an account of thy stewardship ; for thou mayest be no longer steward .
text2: ` Nuna antuk ni Wáinniurin untsuk " ṡWarinia jusha turamainia ? timiai . Yamaikia winia Wáinniur áchattame . Tuma asamtai winia Kuítrujai itiurkamea nu iniaktursata " timiai . '

text: Then the steward said within himself , What shall I do ? for my lord taketh away from me the stewardship : I cannot dig ; to beg I am ashamed .
text2: ` Tutai takatan Wáinin Enentáimsamai . " Maaj , wisha itiurkatjak , timiai . Nunka Táurtinniasha jeatsjai . " Kuit surusta " Títinniasha natsamajai .

text: I am resolved what to do , that , when I am put out of the stewardship , they may receive me into their houses .
text2: Winia takatur atsakui yurumkan ajamprusarat tusan Túratajna nuna nekajai " tu Enentáimsamai .

text: So he called every one of his lord ' s debtors unto him , and said unto the first , How much owest thou unto my lord ?
text2: Nuyá nérenniun tumashmaku armia nuna ankant ankant untsukarmai . Emka tamia nuna chicharuk " ṡWinia uuntur urutma tumashmakuitiam ? " timiai . '

text: And he said , An hundred measures of oil . And he said unto him , Take thy bill , and sit down quickly , and write fifty .
text2: ` Niisha aimiuk " Asuitin sian taru tumashiitjai " timiai . ' ` Tutai takata Wáinin chicharuk " Pai . Papinium tumashrum ana nu Juá : Wárikmasmek pujusam , nu Papí jaakam , Chíkich papinium aya senkuentachik aarta " timiai . '

text: Then said he to another , And how much owest thou ? And he said , An hundred measures of wheat . And he said unto him , Take thy bill , and write fourscore .
text2: ` Nuyá Chíkich tumashmaku Támatai " ṡAmesha Urutmá tumashiitiam ? " timiai . ' ` Tutai nii chichaak " Shana sian taru tumashiitjai " timiai . ' ` Tutai " Pai . Papinium tumashrum ana nu Júiti . Chíkich papinium aya uchentak aarta " timiai . '

text: And the lord commended the unjust steward , because he had done wisely : for the children of this world are in their generation wiser than the children of light .
text2: ` Nuyá takata Wáinniu uuntri nuna Nekáa " Nii yajauch Túriniaitiat Imiá Enentáimniuiti " timiai ' Tímiayi . Nuyá Jesus Tímiayi ` Yus - shuarjai nankaamas Yus - shuarcha aijiai ni Túratniuriniak takainiak Imiá Enentáimkia ainiawai . '

text: And I say unto you , Make to yourselves friends of the mammon of unrighteousness ; that , when ye fail , they may receive you into everlasting habitations .
text2: ` Ju nunkanam anankatin átsuk . Tura kuitsha aya ju nunkanmayankete . Tuma asamtai atumsha kuitrumjai " shuaran yaintaj " tu Enentáimsatarum . Kuitjai yaintin amuukamtai atumsha amuicha jeanam ipiaamu átaj tusarum Túratarum . "

text: He that is faithful in that which is least is faithful also in much : and he that is unjust in the least is unjust also in much .
text2: ` Shuar ishichik takakna nujai pénker Túrakka , Núkap takakna nujaisha pénker Túrattawai . Tura ishichik takakna nujai pénker Túrachkunka , Núkap takakna nujaisha pénker Túrashtatui .

text: If therefore ye have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon , who will commit to your trust the true riches ?
text2: Tuma asamtai ju nunkanmaya anankartin kuitjai pénker Túrachkurmeka , tuke átin ana nujai takastincha ṡitiur takastarumek ?

text: And if ye have not been faithful in that which is another man ' s , who shall give you that which is your own ?
text2: Takakme nuna Yus ikiatmasuiti . Nujai pénker Túrachkurminkia , atumnia átinia nuna ṡitiurak suramsat ~ i ? '

text: No servant can serve two masters : for either he will hate the one , and love the other ; or else he will hold to the one , and despise the other . Ye cannot serve God and mammon .
text2: ` Takarniuri Jimiará uuntrintin ajastinian tujintiawai . Warí , chikichnaka aneak chikichnaka nakitrashtatuak . Chikichan umiruk chikichnaka umirkashtatui . Yussha kuitcha Mái - metek Enentáimtuschamniaitrume " Tímiayi Jesus .

text: And the Pharisees also , who were covetous , heard all these things : and they derided him .
text2: Pariséusha Kuítian anen armia nu , Ashí ni Táman antukar Jesusan wishikrarmiayi .

text: And he said unto them , Ye are they which justify yourselves before men ; but God knoweth your hearts : for that which is highly esteemed among men is abomination in the sight of God .
text2: Túmakui Jesus niin Tímiayi " Atumsha aents iimmianum pénker awajmamprume . Túrasha Atumí Enentáincha Yus pénker nékawai . Kame winia " nankaamantuiti " turutit tusa wakera nuna Yuska nakitiawai . '

text: The law and the prophets were until John : since that time the kingdom of God is preached , and every man presseth into it .
text2: ` Juan étsertsain Muisáis aar akupkamia nunasha tura Yúsnan etserin unuiniarmia nunasha antuktin ármiayi . Tura yamaisha Tímianiai ti shiir chicham awai . Yus akupeana nui urukukit nuka paant etserkamuiti . Tura Ashí shuar nui pachiinkiataj tusar ni kakarmarijiain ti takainiawai . '

text: And it is easier for heaven and earth to pass , than one tittle of the law to fail .
text2: ` Túrasha yaunchu akupkamu Ashí chicham uminkiatniuiti . Nu chicham uminkiashtinkia nayaimpisha nunkasha amukatniujai nankaamas itiurchataiti . '

text: Whosoever putteth away his wife , and marrieth another , committeth adultery : and whosoever marrieth her that is put away from her husband committeth adultery .
text2: ` Aishman nuarin ajapa chikichan Nuátkunka tsanirmawai . Tura nuwa ajapamu niiniurtakka nusha Núnisan tsanirmawai . '

text: There was a certain rich man , which was clothed in purple and fine linen , and fared sumptuously every day :
text2: ` Aishman Kuítrintin ámai . Niisha Imiá shiir pushin ti kuit ainia nujai iwiarmamniuyi . Tura tuke tsawant yurumak ti kuit amia nujai namperan najanniuyi .

text: And there was a certain beggar named Lazarus , which was laid at his gate , full of sores ,
text2: Tura Kuítrincha ámai ni naari Rásaru . Niisha kuchapruku tunamaruyi . Tuke tsawant Kuítrinniu Wáitiriin pujuyi .

text: And desiring to be fed with the crumbs which fell from the rich man ' s table : moreover the dogs came and licked his sores .
text2: Ti tsukamak Kuítrinniu misarinia kakekan yuattsa wakerimiai . Tura yawasha ni kuchaprin nukatiarmai .

text: And it came to pass , that the beggar died , and was carried by the angels into Abraham ' s bosom : the rich man also died , and was buried ;
text2: Kuítrincha jakamai . Jakamtai jaka shiir pujutainium , Apraám pujumia nui nayaimpinmaya suntar Júkiarmai . Kuítrinniusha jakamai . Jakamtai iwiarsarmai .

text: And in hell he lift up his eyes , being in torments , and seeth Abraham afar off , and Lazarus in his bosom .
text2: Jaka pujutainium Wáitias pujus , Pankái iimias , Rásarun Apraámjai pujuinian Wáinkiamai .

text: And he cried and said , Father Abraham , have mercy on me , and send Lazarus , that he may dip the tip of his finger in water , and cool my tongue ; for I am tormented in this flame .
text2: Wáiniak untsumuk " Apawá Apraamá Wáitnentrurta , timiai . Rásaruka tsara uwejejai entsan uchupir winia iniairun imichturat akupturkata . Wisha jui jinium pujusan ti waitiajai " timiai . '

text: But Abraham said , Son , remember that thou in thy lifetime receivedst thy good things , and likewise Lazarus evil things : but now he is comforted , and thou art tormented .
text2: ` Tutai Apraám timiai " Uchirú Enentáimpratá . Ame Nunká iwiaaku pujusam ti shiir pujumame . Antsu Rásaruka nui ti yajauch pujumai . Tura niisha yamaikia jui áyamui tura ámeka Wáitiame .

text: And beside all this , between us and you there is a great gulf fixed : so that they which would pass from hence to you cannot ; neither can they pass to us , that would come from thence .
text2: Tura Nú arant Nánata ti uunt awai . Tuma asamtai Juyá ai wétinian wakeruiniayat tujintiainiawai . Tura aiya jui Tátinian wakeruinia nusha tujintiainiawai . " '

text: Then he said , I pray thee therefore , father , that thou wouldest send him to my father ' s house :
text2: ` Nuinkia Kuítrintin timiai " Nuinkia Apawá Apraamá , juna seajme . Winia aparu jeen Rasaru akupturkata .

text: For I have five brethren ; that he may testify unto them , lest they also come into this place of torment .
text2: Nuisha winia yatsur senku matsatainiawai . Niisha ju Wáitsatniunam Tácharat tusa Ujákartí , Tájame " timiai . '

text: Abraham saith unto him , They have Moses and the prophets ; let them hear them .
text2: ` Tutai Apraám timiai " Muisáis aarman tura Yúsnan etserin aarman takakainiawai . Nuna umikiarti . " '

text: And he said , Nay , father Abraham : but if one went unto them from the dead , they will repent .
text2: ` Tutai Kuítrintin aimkiamai " Túrasha apawa Apraamá , antsu jakamunmaya nantaki , shuar we ujakam Enentáin Yapajiáwarainti . " '

text: And he said unto him , If they hear not Moses and the prophets , neither will they be persuaded , though one rose from the dead .
text2: ` Tura Apraám timiai " Muisáis aarman tura Yúsnan etserin aarman anturainiachkunka jaka nantaki we ujakmasha antukchartatui " timiai . " Tu áujmatsamiayi Jesus .

text: Then said he unto the disciples , It is impossible but that offences will come : but woe unto him , through whom they come !
text2: Jesus ni unuiniamurin juna Tímiayi , " Aentsun yajauchin Túrumtikiattana nu tuke átatui . Tura shuar ni ain tunaan wakerumtikna nu Aneartí .

text: It were better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck , and he cast into the sea , than that he should offend one of these little ones .
text2: Ju shuar uchich ainia nuna yajauchinium Túrumtikna nuna Yus Imiá Asutiáttawai . Tuma asamtai nuna Túratsain uunt kayajai kuntujnum Jinkiá nayaantsanam ajunkam maak ainti .

text: Take heed to yourselves : If thy brother trespass against thee , rebuke him ; and if he repent , forgive him .
text2: Túrasha atumek iimiastarum . Ame yatsum ámin Tunáa Túrutmamtainkia chicharkata ; tura niisha " tsankurturta " Túramkuinkia tsankurata .

text: And if he trespass against thee seven times in a day , and seven times in a day turn again to thee , saying , I repent ; thou shalt forgive him .
text2: Chikichík tsawantinin siati Túrutmamtai , tura " tsankurturta , atakka Túrashtatjai , " siati Túramkuinkia , tuke tsankurata . "

text: And the apostles said unto the Lord , Increase our faith .
text2: Jesusa unuiniamuri Niin chicharuk " Yus Enentáimtajnia Nú nankaamas Enentáimtustin Yáinmaktá " tiarmiayi .

text: And the Lord said , If ye had faith as a grain of mustard seed , ye might say unto this sycamine tree , Be thou plucked up by the root , and be thou planted in the sea ; and it should obey you .
text2: Tutai Jesus Tímiayi " Mustasa Jinkiái ti Ishitiúpchich ana Núnisan ishichkisha Yus Enentáimtaitkiurmeka , sikiumuru numi wajana nu , " Wajamurmiyanka ukuiniakam nayaantsanam wajasta " Tákurmin Nú numi umirtamkainti . '

text: But which of you , having a servant plowing or feeding cattle , will say unto him by and by , when he is come from the field , Go and sit down to meat ?
text2: ` Atumí takarniuri arakmasua amik , waakancha iis Támatai , ṡNú chichamaik amesha , " Winitiá , Yurumáitiá " Tíintmek ?

text: And will not rather say unto him , Make ready wherewith I may sup , and gird thyself , and serve me , till I have eaten and drunken ; and afterward thou shalt eat and drink ?
text2: Atsá . Antsu , " yurumak iwiarturata . Wi Yurumátin tura umartincha surusminiam iwiarnarta . Nuyá ame Yurumátá . " Nu Tíchaintmek .

text: Doth he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded him ? I trow not .
text2: Nii Túratin ana nunak Túratsuk . Tuma asamtai yuminsashtatme .

text: So likewise ye , when ye shall have done all those things which are commanded you , say , We are unprofitable servants : we have done that which was our duty to do .
text2: Atumsha Núnisrumek Yus Túramna nu Ashí umikiam " ti penker Túraitjai " Tíchatniuitme . Antsu " aya ii Túratniuri ana nuke tura asar iikia ántraitji " Títiniaitme . " Tu Tímiayi Jesus .

text: And it came to pass , as he went to Jerusalem , that he passed through the midst of Samaria and Galilee .
text2: Jesus Jerusarénnum wesa Kariréa nunka ikiuki Samaria nunkanam nankaamakmiayi .

text: And as he entered into a certain village , there met him ten men that were lepers , which stood afar off :
text2: Tura péprunam jeamtai , tias aishman ripra sunkurjai tunamaru armia nu , arant wajasarmiayi .

text: And they lifted up their voices , and said , Jesus , Master , have mercy on us .
text2: Tura untsumainiak " Uunt Jesusá , waitnentrurta " tiarmiayi .

text: And when he saw them , he said unto them , Go shew yourselves unto the priests . And it came to pass , that , as they went , they were cleansed .
text2: Jesus niin Wáiniak , " Pátrii werirum iniaktumastarum " Tímiayi . Tura wésar pénker ajasarmiayi .

text: And one of them , when he saw that he was healed , turned back , and with a loud voice glorified God ,
text2: Nuyá chikichik ni tsuamarman Nekáa kakantar chichaki Yusa Náarin uunt awajki waketki Jesusan tarimiayi .

text: And fell down on his face at his feet , giving him thanks : and he was a Samaritan .
text2: Yuminsataj tusa Jesusan tikishmatar piniakumar tepesmiayi . Nu aishmanka Samarianmayauyayi .

text: And Jesus answering said , Were there not ten cleansed ? but where are the nine ?
text2: Nuna Wáiniak Jesus Tímiayi " Tsuámaru Tiáschakait . ṡChíkich nuiwisha tui pujuinia ?

text: There are not found that returned to give glory to God , save this stranger .
text2: ṡJu yajaya aishman Nínkik Yusa naari uunt awajsataj tusa waketki tai ? "

text: And he said unto him , Arise , go thy way : thy faith hath made thee whole .
text2: Nuyá aishmankan Tímiayi , " Winia nekas Enentáimtursa asam pénker ajasume . Wajakim shiir weta " Tímiayi Jesus .

text: And when he was demanded of the Pharisees , when the kingdom of God should come , he answered them and said , The kingdom of God cometh not with observation :
text2: Pariséu aents Jesusan Aníak " ṡYusa akupeamuri urutaik ati ? " tiarmiayi . Tutai Jesus Tímiayi , " Yusa akupeamuri paant Wáinkiachminiaiti . " Yamaí nankamnayi " tichamniaiti .

text: Neither shall they say , Lo here ! or , lo there ! for , behold , the kingdom of God is within you .
text2: " Jui awai , nuisha awai " Tíchamniaiti . Warí , Yusa akupeamurinkia atumiin pujawai " Tímiayi .

text: And he said unto the disciples , The days will come , when ye shall desire to see one of the days of the Son of man , and ye shall not see it .
text2: Nuyá ni unuiniamurin chicharuk juna Tímiayi : " Tsawant jeattawai atumsha Winia Aents Ajasu tutain " aya Chikichík tsawantkesha Nii Wáinkiarkia mak " turuttiatrume . Túrasha tujinkiattarme .

text: And they shall say to you , See here ; or , see there : go not after them , nor follow them .
text2: Aents Ajasu tutai " jui pujawai , nuisha pujawai " Tuíniakui weriirap . Tana nu nemariirap .

text: For as the lightning , that lighteneth out of the one part under heaven , shineth unto the other part under heaven ; so shall also the Son of man be in his day .
text2: Wi , Aents Ajasuitjiana nu Tátinian tsawantur jeamtai paant Wáitkiattarme . Peem péetuk Ashí nayaimpin Tsáapnin awajna Núnisan wi taamu paant átatui .

text: But first must he suffer many things , and be rejected of this generation .
text2: Tura nu Túruntsain yamai pujuinia nu Winia nakitruiniakui ti Wáitsatniuitjai .

text: And as it was in the days of Noe , so shall it be also in the days of the Son of man .
text2: Winia atak Tátiniur jeamtai , yaunchu Nuái pujumia Nú tsawantin Túrunamia Núnisan Túrunattawai .

text: They did eat , they drank , they married wives , they were given in marriage , until the day that Noe entered into the ark , and the flood came , and destroyed them all .
text2: Yurumáwarmiayi , umararmiayi , nuatnaikiarmiayi , ni nawantri nuatnakat tusa surukarmiayi . Tumáa pujuiniai Nuái uunt kanunam enkempramtai , amaarak nu aentsnasha mash amuukarmiayi .

text: Likewise also as it was in the days of Lot ; they did eat , they drank , they bought , they sold , they planted , they builded ;
text2: Tura Sutuma péprunmasha Rauta írutramurisha Núnisaran Yusa Asutiátniuri Enentáimtutsuk pujuarmiayi . Yurumáwarmiayi , umararmiayi , sumakarmiayi , surukarmiayi , ajancha ajamarmiayi , jeancha jeammarmiayi .

text: But the same day that Lot went out of Sodom it rained fire and brimstone from heaven , and destroyed them all .
text2: Tura Raut Sutuma péprunmaya jiinkimtai asupri tutai kaya keek Yútana aintsan nayaimpinmaya kakeetuk nu aentsun mash Máawarmiayi .

text: Even thus shall it be in the day when the Son of man is revealed .
text2: Núnisan winia atak Tátiniur jeamtai Enentáimtsuk pujusartatui . '

text: In that day , he which shall be upon the housetop , and his stuff in the house , let him not come down to take it away : and he that is in the field , let him likewise not return back .
text2: ` Nu tsawant jeamtai jea yakiini pujana Nú shuar ni waririn achiktaj tusa akaikishti . Jeá wayashti . Tura kampunniunam wekaana Nú shuar ni jeen waketkishti .

text: Remember Lot ' s wife .
text2: Rauta Nuarí Túrunamu Enentáimpratarum .

text: Whosoever shall seek to save his life shall lose it ; and whosoever shall lose his life shall preserve it .
text2: Aya ju nunkanmayan Enentáimias " iwiaaku átaj " tana nu ni iwiaakmarin Emenkáktatui . Tura ju nunkanam ni iwiaakmarin emenkana nu nekas iwiaakma ana nuna Wáinkiáttawai .

text: I tell you , in that night there shall be two men in one bed ; the one shall be taken , and the other shall be left .
text2: Paant Tájarme . Nú Káshitin Jimiará aishman nuu peaknuman Kanúu tepeartatui . Chikichik junaktiatui , Chíkichkia ikiunkittiawai .

text: Two women shall be grinding together ; the one shall be taken , and the other left .
text2: Jimiará nuwa Mái - metek nekée pujuartatui . Chikichik junaktiatui , Chíkichkia ikiunkittiawai .

text: Two men shall be in the field ; the one shall be taken , and the other left .
text2: Jimiará aishman kampuniunam wekainiartatui . Chikichik junaktiatui , Chíkichkia ikiunkittiawai . " Tu Tímiayi .

text: And they answered and said unto him , Where , Lord ? And he said unto them , Wheresoever the body is , thither will the eagles be gathered together .
text2: Nuna antukar " Uunta ṡtui Túrunatta ? " tiarmiayi . Tutai ni chichaak " Jaka tepana nui chuan Káutkartatui . "

text: And he spake a parable unto them to this end , that men ought always to pray , and not to faint ;
text2: Shuar yawetsuk Yúsan tuke áujsatniua nuna unuiniartaj tusa Jesus ju métek - taku chichaman Tímiayi :

text: Saying , There was in a city a judge , which feared not God , neither regarded man :
text2: " Chíkich péprunam shuaran akupin amai . Nú aishman Yúsnasha ashamchauyi ; Shuárnasha pénker Enentáimtichuyi .

text: And there was a widow in that city ; and she came unto him , saying , Avenge me of mine adversary .
text2: Tura Nú péprunam waje amai . Niisha Shuáran akupniun chicharuk " Aishman winia yajauch awajtusmania nu iirtusta " tusa tuke Waketrú pujuyi .

text: And he would not for a while : but afterward he said within himself , Though I fear not God , nor regard man ;
text2: Yámankamtaikkia niin anturkatniun nakitmiai . Tura ukunam Enentáimias " Wisha Yúsan ashamachiatnak Shuárnasha pénker Enentáimtichuitiatnak ju waje tana nuna Túrattajai .

text: Yet because this widow troubleth me , I will avenge her , lest by her continual coming she weary me .
text2: Warí niisha tuke taa itit awajtatsuk . Tuma asamtai niin kajerkaij tusan Wárik Túrattajai " timiai " Tímiayi .

text: And the Lord said , Hear what the unjust judge saith .
text2: Nuyá uunt Jesus Tímiayi " Shuaran akupin yajauchiitiat nuna timiai .

text: And shall not God avenge his own elect , which cry day and night unto him , though he bear long with them ?
text2: Tura Yus ti pénker asa , ni achikmarin tsawaisha , Káshisha untsuamka Nú nankaamas anturkashtatuak . ṡYaitsuk menkakatuak ?

text: I tell you that he will avenge them speedily . Nevertheless when the Son of man cometh , shall he find faith on the earth ?
text2: Atsá , Wárik Yáinkiartatui , Tájarme . Tura Wi Aents Ajasuitjiana ju atak Támatai , ṡshuaran tuke Winia nekas Enentáimturainia nuna Wáinkiatjash ? " Tímiayi Jesus .

text: And he spake this parable unto certain which trusted in themselves that they were righteous , and despised others :
text2: " Pénkeraitjai " tu Enentáimtumainiak chikichnaka yajauch Enentáimtiarmia nuna Jesus Nekapmá chichasmiayi . Juna Tímiayi :

text: Two men went up into the temple to pray ; the one a Pharisee , and the other a publican .
text2: " Jimiará aishman Yusa Uunt Jeen Yus áujsatai tusar wearmai . Chíkichkia Pariséuuyi , Chíkichkia Kuítian - juuyi .

text: The Pharisee stood and prayed thus with himself , God , I thank thee , that I am not as other men are , extortioners , unjust , adulterers , or even as this publican .
text2: Pariséusha wajaki Yúsan áujuk Júnis Tímiayi : " Yusrú , Chíkich aishman kasa , yajauch , tsanirmau ainia nujai métekcha asan yuminsajme . Tura ju Kuítian - juu wajana Jújaisha métekchaitjai .

text: I fast twice in the week , I give tithes of all that I possess .
text2: Warí , Ame akupkamna nuna iniankasan wisha Chikichík semanatinin Jimiará tsawant ijiarman áujeajai ; tura wi achiajna nuna Tiásnumia chikichkiniak Yúsnaiti tusan akankan Súajai . " Tu Tímiai . '

text: And the publican , standing afar off , would not lift up so much as his eyes unto heaven , but smote upon his breast , saying , God be merciful to me a sinner .
text2: ` Tura Kuítian - juusha arant wajas , nayaimpinmaani Pankái iimsatniunkesha natsaamak , tsuntsuma , ni netsepen Awatí " Yusá , ti tunaitjai . Waitnéntrurtá " timiai . '

text: I tell you , this man went down to his house justified rather than the other : for every one that exalteth himself shall be abased ; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted .
text2: ` Wats Tájarme , nu Kuítian - juu shuar Yus iimmianum ni Enentái pénker awajnas ni jeen waketkimiai . Tura Pariséuka tamia Núnisan waketkimiai . Nekaatarum . Shuar nankaamantu Enentáimtumana nuka péejchach awajnastatui . Tura antsu péejchach Enentáimtumana nu , nankaamantu awajnastatui " Tímiayi Jesus .

text: And they brought unto him also infants , that he would touch them : but when his disciples saw it , they rebuked them .
text2: Jesus antinkiarat tusar uchin itiariarmiayi . Tura Jesusa unuiniamurisha nuna Wáinkiar suritkiarmiayi .

text: But Jesus called them unto him , and said , Suffer little children to come unto me , and forbid them not : for of such is the kingdom of God .
text2: Tura Jesus niin untsukar Tímiayi " Uchi Winí winitin tsankamkatarum , surimkiairap . Enentáimsatarum . Uchichia aintsan Enentáimtumana Nú Shuárak Yus ni Enentáin akupin ajasminiaiti .

text: Verily I say unto you , Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child shall in no wise enter therein .
text2: Uchi ni uuntrin umira Núnisan shuar Yúsan Umíachkunka Yus ni Enentáin akupin ajaschamniaiti . " Tu Tímiayi Jesus .

text: And a certain ruler asked him , saying , Good Master , what shall I do to inherit eternal life ?
text2: Shuara uuntri Jesusan Tarí áujsamiayi . " Uuntá , amesha pénkeraitme . Tuma asam , turuttia , ṡwarinia Túrakna tuke iwiaaku átataj ? " Tímiayi .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Why callest thou me good ? none is good , save one , that is , God .
text2: Tutai Jesus , " ṡUrukamtia Winia , pénkeraitme , Túrutam ? Aents pénkerka atsawai . Aya Yusak pénkeraiti .

text: Thou knowest the commandments , Do not commit adultery , Do not kill , Do not steal , Do not bear false witness , Honour thy father and thy mother .
text2: Tura Yus akupkamu ana nu pénker nékame . Tsanirmawairap , mankartuawairap , kasamkairap , tsanumprurairap , ame apasha , nukusha shiir Enentáimtustarum . Nusha nékame " Tímiayi .

text: And he said , All these have I kept from my youth up .
text2: Tutai aishman Tímiayi " Uuntá , úchichik mash umiki tsakaruitjai . "

text: Now when Jesus heard these things , he said unto him , Yet lackest thou one thing : sell all that thou hast , and distribute unto the poor , and thou shalt have treasure in heaven : and come , follow me .
text2: Jesus nuna antuk " Chikichik taatramsai , Tímiayi . Ame takakmena nu Ashí surukam Kuítrincha ainia nu susarta . Nuinkia nayaimpiniam Kuítrum átatui . Túram nemartustaj tusam winitia . "

text: And when he heard this , he was very sorrowful : for he was very rich .
text2: Tura nuna antuk , nu aishman ti Kuítrintin asa ti kuntuts Enentáimpramiayi .

text: And when Jesus saw that he was very sorrowful , he said , How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God !
text2: Tura Kúntuts Enentáimpramtai Jesus nuna Nekáa " Kuítrintin ainia nu Yus akupeamunam pachiinkiatin ti iturchataiti , Tímiayi .

text: For it is easier for a camel to go through a needle ' s eye , than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God .
text2: Kamiriuka , uunt ana nu , auja jiin wayatin itiurchataiti . Tura shuar Kuítrin ti Enentáimtana nu Yus akupeamunam pachiinkiatin Nú nankaamas itiurchataiti . " Tu Tímiayi .

text: And they that heard it said , Who then can be saved ?
text2: Tura nuna antukarmia nu tiarmiayi " ṡNuinkia yaki uwempramniait ? "

text: And he said , The things which are impossible with men are possible with God .
text2: Tutai Jesus Tímiayi " Aents tujintiainia nuna Yuska Páchitsuk Túramniaiti . "

text: Then Peter said , Lo , we have left all , and followed thee .
text2: Nuyá Pítiur Niin chicharuk Tímiayi " Uuntá , iikia Amin nemarsataj tusar ii takakmaaka ikiukji . "

text: Who shall not receive manifold more in this present time , and in the world to come life everlasting .
text2: Tutai Jesus Tímiayi " Shuar Yus akupeana nuna Túrataj tusa ni jeen ikiuakka tura Núnisan ni Aparíncha , Nukuríncha , yachinkisha , nuwenkesha , Uchirínkisha ikiuakka ju nunkanmasha Núkap Wáinkiattawai nu shuar . Tura tuke iwiaaku pujustinniasha Wáinkiattawai . "

text: Then he took unto him the twelve , and said unto them , Behold , we go up to Jerusalem , and all things that are written by the prophets concerning the Son of man shall be accomplished .
text2: Jesus ni tuse unuiniamurin akanki ikiaanak juna Tímiayi : " Jerusarénnum jeatemaji . Juisha Jerusarénnum Winia , Aents Ajasu tutain , Túrunatniurun Yúsnan etserin yaunchu aatrurarmia nu uminkiattawai .

text: For he shall be delivered unto the Gentiles , and shall be mocked , and spitefully entreated , and spitted on :
text2: Apachnium surutkartatui . Túrawar wishikrurar , katsekrukar usukruawartatui .

text: And they shall scourge him , and put him to death : and the third day he shall rise again .
text2: Awatiar Mantuáwartatui . Túramaitiatnak Menaintiú tsawantai nantaktiatjai " Tímiayi .

text: And they understood none of these things : and this saying was hid from them , neither knew they the things which were spoken .
text2: Tura Nii Tímiania nuna nekas Túrunattawai , Tícharmiayi . Wariniak ta tusar nekaacharmiayi .

text: And it came to pass , that as he was come nigh unto Jericho , a certain blind man sat by the way side begging :
text2: Jesus Jirikiú péprunam nuntumsai , nui aishman jii kusuru , Kuítian surusarat tusa Jintiá pujumiayi .

text: And hearing the multitude pass by , he asked what it meant .
text2: Untsurí aents nankaamainian antuk " ṡwarinkit ? " Tímiayi .

text: And they told him , that Jesus of Nazareth passeth by .
text2: Tutai , " Nasarétnumia Jesus nankaamawai " tiarmiayi .

text: And he cried , saying , Jesus , thou Son of David , have mercy on me .
text2: Kusurusha nuna antuk untsumuk " Jesusá , Uunt Kapitián Tawit weeachukaitiam . Tátiniuya Núchakaitiam . Winiaja waitnentrurta " Tímiayi .

text: And they which went before rebuked him , that he should hold his peace : but he cried so much the more , Thou Son of David , have mercy on me .
text2: Eemak wearmiania nu chicharainiak " takamatsata " tiarmiayi . Tutaisha Nú arant untsumuk " Tawit weeachukaitiam ; winiaja waitnentrurta " Tímiayi .

text: And Jesus stood , and commanded him to be brought unto him : and when he was come near , he asked him ,
text2: Nuinkia Jesus wajas " itiatarum " Tímiayi . Tura nii Támatai ,

text: Saying , What wilt thou that I shall do unto thee ? And he said , Lord , that I may receive my sight .
text2: " ṡWarí itiurtukat tusamea wakerutam ? " Tímiayi . Tutai kusuru aimiuk " Uuntá , iimtiasan wakerajai " Tímiayi .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Receive thy sight : thy faith hath saved thee .
text2: Tutai Jesus chichaak " Iimtia . Winia nekas Enentáimtursa asam pénker ajasume " Tímiayi .

text: And immediately he received his sight , and followed him , glorifying God : and all the people , when they saw it , gave praise unto God .
text2: Nu chichamaik kusuru iimmiayi . Tura Yusa naari uunt awajki Jesusan nemarmiayi . Tura Ashí aents nuna Wáinkiarmia nusha Yusa Náarin uunt awajsarmiayi .

text: And Jesus entered and passed through Jericho .
text2: Nuyá Jirikiú péprunam Wayá nui wekaikini ajamiayi .

text: And , behold , there was a man named Zacchaeus , which was the chief among the publicans , and he was rich .
text2: Nui Kuítrintin aishman ni naari Sakíu pujumiayi . Nu Sakíu Kuítian - juu uuntriyayi .

text: And he sought to see Jesus who he was ; and could not for the press , because he was little of stature .
text2: Aents ti Káunkámtai , Sakíu ti Sútarach asa , Jesusan iistaj Tukamá tujinkiamiayi .

text: And he ran before , and climbed up into a sycomore tree to see him : for he was to pass that way .
text2: Tuma asa Jesus nuke nankaamaktin asamtai , eemki tsékinki sikiumuru numi wajamunam wakamiayi iistaj tusa .

text: And when Jesus came to the place , he looked up , and saw him , and said unto him , Zacchaeus , make haste , and come down ; for to day I must abide at thy house .
text2: Jesus nui nankaamak Pankái iimias chicharuk " Sakíu Wárik Akáikitiá . Ame jeemiin Yamái kanartiniaitjai " Tímiayi .

text: And he made haste , and came down , and received him joyfully .
text2: Tutai Sakíusha Wárik akaiki , shiir Enentáimias Jesusan itiaamiayi .

text: And when they saw it , they all murmured , saying , That he was gone to be guest with a man that is a sinner .
text2: Ashí aents nuna Wáinkiar " Maaj , Jesus Tunáa aishmanka jeen pujawai " tusa mai tunaim ajarmiayi .

text: And Zacchaeus stood , and said unto the Lord ; Behold , Lord , the half of my goods I give to the poor ; and if I have taken any thing from any man by false accusation , I restore him fourfold .
text2: Nuyá Sakíu wajaki Jesusan chicharuk " Iistá Uuntá , wi takakjana juna Jímiapetek nakakan Kuítrincha ainia nuna susartatjai . Tura Wáitruan chikichan kasarkaitkiuncha menaintiu patatsan awainkittiajai " Tímiayi .

text: And Jesus said unto him , This day is salvation come to this house , forsomuch as he also is a son of Abraham .
text2: Tutai Jesus Tímiayi " Ju aishman Apraáma Shuárintiat Yamái niisha Níiniujai uwempra asa nekas Apraáma shuari ajasuiti .

text: For the Son of man is come to seek and to save that which was lost .
text2: Wisha Aents Ajasu asan menkakaru ainia nuna eakan uwemtikrartaj tusan Táwitjai . " Tu Tímiayi .

text: And as they heard these things , he added and spake a parable , because he was nigh to Jerusalem , and because they thought that the kingdom of God should immediately appear .
text2: Nu aents Jesusan anturkarmia nu " Jerusarénnum jeawakrin Nii , Yus anaikiamu asa , Wárik akupin ajastatui " tu Enentáimsarmiayi . Tuma asamtai wésar Jerusarénnum nuntumsarai , nuna Enentáimsaráin tusa Jesus juna métek - takun chichasmiayi :

text: He said therefore , A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom , and to return .
text2: " Aishman penkeri amai . Nu aishmansha jeachat Chíkich Núnkanam Kapitián Náamkan Tátaj tusa wemai .

text: And he called his ten servants , and delivered them ten pounds , and said unto them , Occupy till I come .
text2: Tura wétsuk ni takarniurin tias armia nuna untsukarmai . Tura ankant ankant kuit kurijiai nankaamas pénker armia nuna Suíniak " Ju kuitjai wi Táatsain Takakmá ajatarum " timiai . '

text: But his citizens hated him , and sent a message after him , saying , We will not have this man to reign over us .
text2: ` Tura ni nunkénia shuarka nakitiarmai . Túmainiak " nu aishman ii Kapitiántri ajasain tusar nakitiaji " nu Titiá tusar aishmankan akatrar akuptukarmai . '

text: And it came to pass , that when he was returned , having received the kingdom , then he commanded these servants to be called unto him , to whom he had given the money , that he might know how much every man had gained by trading .
text2: ` Tuma ain Kapitián Náamak ni nunkén waketki tamai . Taa " winia Kuítrujai Warí Túrarum " Títiaj tusa ni takarniurin kuitia Súsarmia nuna untsukarmai . '

text: Then came the first , saying , Lord , thy pound hath gained ten pounds .
text2: ` Ni takarniuri emka chikichik taa " ame Kuítrumjai takakmasan tias patasan achikmajai " timiai . '

text: And he said unto him , Well , thou good servant : because thou hast been faithful in a very little , have thou authority over ten cities .
text2: ` Tutai Kapitián chichaak " Pénker Túrame . Ishichik susamjamna Nújaink ~ i wi Tímiajna Tímiatrusmek Túrame . Tuma asakmin tias péprun akupin awajsattajme " timiai . '

text: And the second came , saying , Lord , thy pound hath gained five pounds .
text2: ` Chíkich taa " Iistá Uuntá , ame Kuítrumjai takakmasan senku patasan achikjai " timiai . '

text: And he said likewise to him , Be thou also over five cities .
text2: ` Nunasha chicharuk " Amincha senku péprun akupin awajsattajme " timiai . '

text: And another came , saying , Lord , behold , here is thy pound , which I have kept laid up in a napkin :
text2: ` Nuyá Chíkich taa " Uuntá , ame Kuítrumin paniijiai ijian ikiusmajai .

text: For I feared thee , because thou art an austere man : thou takest up that thou layedst not down , and reapest that thou didst not sow .
text2: Amesha kakaram chichau asakmin , ikiuschiatam achin asakmin tura arakmachiatam juu asakmin ashamkamjame " timiai . '

text: And he saith unto him , Out of thine own mouth will I judge thee , thou wicked servant . Thou knewest that I was an austere man , taking up that I laid not down , and reaping that I did not sow :
text2: ` Tutai Kapitián timiai " Maaj , amesha ti yajauchiitme . Ame Támena nuke makurmawai . Wi kakaram chichau aisha , ikiuschiatan achin aisha tura araknasha arakmachiatan juu aisha ,

text: Wherefore then gavest not thou my money into the bank , that at my coming I might have required mine own with usury ?
text2: nuinkia ṡurukamtia kuit - ikiutainiam ikiuschamam ? Nuinkia wi atak Táakun patasan achikiaajna " timiai .

text: And he said unto them that stood by , Take from him the pound , and give it to him that hath ten pounds .
text2: Tura nui wajarmia nuna chicharuk " Kuítian takakmari juruktiarum ; Túrarum tias takakna Nú shuar susatarum " timiai . '

text: ( And they said unto him , Lord , he hath ten pounds . )
text2: ` Tura niisha chichainiak " Túrasha Uuntá , tias takakja " tiarmai . '

text: For I say unto you , That unto every one which hath shall be given ; and from him that hath not , even that he hath shall be taken away from him .
text2: ` Tutai Kapitián chichaak " Takakna nujai takaakuinkia patatnastatui Tájarme . Tura takakna nujai takaachkuinkia ishichik takakkuisha jurunkittiawai .

text: But those mine enemies , which would not that I should reign over them , bring hither , and slay them before me .
text2: Tura winia nemasur Kapitián ajasain tusar nakitrurarmania nu itiatarum . Tura wisha iimiain Máatárum " timiai . " Tu Tímiayi Jesus .

text: And when he had thus spoken , he went before , ascending up to Jerusalem .
text2: Nuna tuasua amik Jesus Jerusarénnumaani wémiayi .

text: And it came to pass , when he was come nigh to Bethphage and Bethany , at the mount called the mount of Olives , he sent two of his disciples ,
text2: Petpajái pepru tura Petania péprusha Uriwiu Náinnium Tíjiuchiyi ; nui jeastatuk ajatemas ni unuiniamurin Jímiaran chicharuk ,

text: Saying , Go ye into the village over against you ; in the which at your entering ye shall find a colt tied , whereon yet never man sat : loose him , and bring him hither .
text2: " Tíjiuch péprunam wetarum . Túrarum nui umpuuruch ekemtukchamu jinkiamu Wajá Wáinkiattarme . Nu Atíarum itiatarum .

text: And if any man ask you , Why do ye loose him ? thus shall ye say unto him , Because the Lord hath need of him .
text2: Tura " ṡurukamtai Atíarum ? " turamainiakuisha , " ii uuntri wakerawai " Títiarum " Tímiayi .

text: And they that were sent went their way , and found even as he had said unto them .
text2: Tutai unuiniamuri wear , Jesus timia ímiatrusan Wáinkiarmiayi

text: And as they were loosing the colt , the owners thereof said unto them , Why loose ye the colt ?
text2: Tura umpuuruchin Atíakui nérentin chichainiak " ṡUrukamtai umpuuruchsha Atíarum ? " tiarmiayi .

text: And they said , The Lord hath need of him .
text2: Tutai unuiniamusha " Ii uuntri wakerawai " tiarmiayi .

text: And they brought him to Jesus : and they cast their garments upon the colt , and they set Jesus thereon .
text2: Tura umpuuruchin Jesusan itiariarmiayi . Túrawar ni pushirin umpuuruchiniam awantkar Jesusan ekenkarmiayi .

text: And as he went , they spread their clothes in the way .
text2: Tura Jesus wétinnium ni pushirin jintianam ayaparar aintrarmiayi .

text: And when he was come nigh , even now at the descent of the mount of Olives , the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works that they had seen ;
text2: Tura Uriwiu naint awankénamunam Tíjiuch ajasarmatai Untsurí aents Jesusan nemariarmia nu warainiak kakantar untsumainiak aents tujintiamun Untsurí Túran Wáinkiaru ásar Yusa Náarin uunt awajsarmiayi .

text: Saying , Blessed be the King that cometh in the name of the Lord : peace in heaven , and glory in the highest .
text2: " Yusa Náaríin winiana ju ii uunt Akupniuiti . Nincha Yus shiir awajsati . Nayaimpiniam pujuinia nu shiir Enentáimsar Yusa Náarin uunt awajsarti " tiarmiayi .

text: And some of the Pharisees from among the multitude said unto him , Master , rebuke thy disciples .
text2: Tura Pariséu aents nui Páchitra pujuarmia nu Jesusan chicharainiak " Uuntá , nemartamainia nu " takamatsata " tiarta " tiarmiayi .

text: And he answered and said unto them , I tell you that , if these should hold their peace , the stones would immediately cry out .
text2: Tutai Jesus Tímiayi " Nuinkia ju takamatsarmatainkia , kayasha untsumkarainti . Nuna paant Tájarme " Tímiayi .

text: And when he was come near , he beheld the city , and wept over it ,
text2: Jerusarénnum Tíjiuch ajatemas péprun Wáiniak uutuk Júnis Tímiayi :

text: Saying , If thou hadst known , even thou , at least in this thy day , the things which belong unto thy peace ! but now they are hid from thine eyes .
text2: " Jerusarénnumia Shuártiram , ju tsawantinkesha shiir pujustintrum nekaarmeka maak . Túrasha yamaikia nekaatin nankaamasai .

text: For the days shall come upon thee , that thine enemies shall cast a trench about thee , and compass thee round , and keep thee in on every side ,
text2: Kame ti itiurchat tsawant jeartamtatrume . Atumí nemasri nunkajai aa - tanishan tanishmarar téntatramkattarme . Mesetan najatramattarme , tura aatusha junisha mash árenmaktatrume .

text: And shall lay thee even with the ground , and thy children within thee ; and they shall not leave in thee one stone upon another ; because thou knewest not the time of thy visitation .
text2: Túrutma Nunká ajunmartatrume . Tura atumiin pujuinia nuna Máawartatui . Tura Ashí emesrarmatai ishichkisha kaya irumpramusha penké atsuttawai . Wi Yusa anaikiamurin tarijrumna nu nekaachu asakrumin Túrutmattarme . " Tu Tímiayi .

text: And he went into the temple , and began to cast out them that sold therein , and them that bought ;
text2: Nuyá Jesus Yusa Uunt Jeen Wayá suruktasa pujuarmia nuna sumaktasa pujuarmia nunasha jiiki awemarmiayi .

text: Saying unto them , It is written , My house is the house of prayer : but ye have made it a den of thieves .
text2: Túrak juna Tímiayi : " Yús - Papinium yaunchu aarma awai : " Winia jearka Yus áujsatin jeaiti " tu aarmaiti . Túrasha átumka Kasáa matsamtaiya Nútikiarme " Tímiayi .

text: And he taught daily in the temple . But the chief priests and the scribes and the chief of the people sought to destroy him ,
text2: Tuke tsawantin Yusa Uunt Jeen Jesus uwempratin chichaman unuiniak pujai Israer - patri uuntrisha , Israer - shuara jintinniurisha , tura pepru uuntrisha , itiur Máamniakit tusar ti Enentáimsarmiayi .

text: And could not find what they might do : for all the people were very attentive to hear him .
text2: Túrasha Ashí aents émamkes anturainiakui Máatniun tujinkiarmiayi .

text: And it came to pass , that on one of those days , as he taught the people in the temple , and preached the gospel , the chief priests and the scribes came upon him with the elders ,
text2: Yusa Uunt Jeen Jesus uwempratin chichaman unuiniak pujai Israer - patri uuntrisha , Israer - shuara jintinniurisha , Israer - shuara uuntrisha Táarmiayi .

text: And spake unto him , saying , Tell us , by what authority doest thou these things ? or who is he that gave thee this authority ?
text2: Taar Jesusan chicharainiak " ṡYana chichamejai ju Túram ? ṡYa ju Túratniuncha akuptamkait ? " tiarmiayi .

text: And he answered and said unto them , I will also ask you one thing ; and answer me :
text2: Tutai Jesus Tímiayi " Wisha aniastajrum tusan wakerajrume .

text: The baptism of John , was it from heaven , or of men ?
text2: ṡYa Juánnasha imiakrattia tusa akupkamia ? ṡYusak ? ṡAentsuk ? Turuttiarum " Tímiayi .

text: And they reasoned with themselves , saying , If we shall say , From heaven ; he will say , Why then believed ye him not ?
text2: Tútaisha niisha nuamtak warintiajik mai tunai ajarmiayi . " " Yus akupkaiti " Tákurninkia , " ṡurukamtai Enentáimtuscharum ? " turamtatji .

text: But and if we say , Of men ; all the people will stone us : for they be persuaded that John was a prophet .
text2: Túrasha " aents akupkaiti " Tákurnisha Ashí aents kayajai tukurmar mantamattaji . Warí " Juan Yúsnan etserniuiti " Tuíniatsuk " tiarmiayi .

text: And they answered , that they could not tell whence it was .
text2: Nuinkia Jesusan ainiak " Iisha nékatsji , Juan imiakratinniasha Yátsuk akupkamia " tiarmiayi .

text: And Jesus said unto them , Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things .
text2: Tutai Jesus Tímiayi " Wisha Núnisnak winia akuptukua nuna Tíchattajrume " Tímiayi .

text: Then began he to speak to the people this parable ; A certain man planted a vineyard , and let it forth to husbandmen , and went into a far country for a long time .
text2: Nuyá Jesus ju métek - taku chichamjai aentsun jintintiamiayi : " Aishman ni ajariin uwa araa amuk , shuaran takartusti tusa ikiukmiai . Tura ninkia wau Táchataj tusa jeachat wémai .

text: And at the season he sent a servant to the husbandmen , that they should give him of the fruit of the vineyard : but the husbandmen beat him , and sent him away empty .
text2: Tura Júuktin tsawant jeamtai juukman akanak jurumkit tusa takarniurin takau shuariin akuptukmai . Tura takarniurincha katsumkar áyatik awainkiarmai .

text: And again he sent another servant : and they beat him also , and entreated him shamefully , and sent him away empty .
text2: Nuyá nérentin Chíkich takarniurin akupkamai ; tura nunasha Núnisan katsekkar , awatiar , Sútsuk akupkarmai .

text: And again he sent a third : and they wounded him also , and cast him out .
text2: Nuyá ataksha chikichan akupkamai . Tura nunasha takau shuar katsumkar akupkarmai . '

text: Then said the lord of the vineyard , What shall I do ? I will send my beloved son : it may be they will reverence him when they see him .
text2: ` Nuyá ukunam Ajá nérenniuri " Itiurkatjak , timiai . Winia aneamu uchirun akupkattajai . Niin Wáinkiar shiir Enentáimtuschartimpiash " timiai . '

text: But when the husbandmen saw him , they reasoned among themselves , saying , This is the heir : come , let us kill him , that the inheritance may be ours .
text2: ` Túrasha takau shuar nuna Wáinkiar , nuamtak chichainiak " Juka Ajá nérenniuri ajastatui . Maatai . Nuikia aja iiniu átatui " tiarmai .

text: So they cast him out of the vineyard , and killed him . What therefore shall the lord of the vineyard do unto them ?
text2: Nuna Tuíniak ajanmaya jiiki Máawarmai . ' Nuyá Jesus aniasmiayi ` Wats ṡWarí Enentáimsarum , Ajá nérenniuri itiurkattawa ?

text: He shall come and destroy these husbandmen , and shall give the vineyard to others . And when they heard it , they said , God forbid .
text2: Niisha taa , nu takau Shuáran Máawartatui . Tura Núnkanka chikichan susattawai " Tímiayi . Nuna anturkar " Yus Núnaka tsankatkashti " tiarmiayi .

text: And he beheld them , and said , What is this then that is written , The stone which the builders rejected , the same is become the head of the corner ?
text2: Tura Jesus niin émamkes iisar Tímiayi " ṡNuikia Yus - Papinium aarma nu warintiua ? Ju aarmaiti : Kayan pénkernak jea jeamin " yajauchiiti " tusar ajapawarmia nu Ashí kayajai nankaamas pénker apujsamuiti .

text: Whosoever shall fall upon that stone shall be broken ; but on whomsoever it shall fall , it will grind him to powder .
text2: Nu kayan tukumainia nuka kupintrattawai . Tura nu kaya shuarnum iniarka nu shuaran tsai tsai awajsattawai . Tu aarmaiti .

text: And the chief priests and the scribes the same hour sought to lay hands on him ; and they feared the people : for they perceived that he had spoken this parable against them .
text2: Israer - patri uuntri tura Israer - shuara jintinniurisha " nu métek - taku chichamjai iin Túramji " tu nekaawar nuik ~ i Jesusan achikiar emetatai tusar wakeriarmiayi . Tura Untsurí shuar Jesusan wakeruiniakui , ashamainiak Túracharmiayi .

text: And they watched him , and sent forth spies , which should feign themselves just men , that they might take hold of his words , that so they might deliver him unto the power and authority of the governor .
text2: Tura Kapitiánnium suruktai tusar wakeruiniak mamikmau shuaran Jesusan akuptukarmiayi . Nu shuar pénker shuara Núnisan jeariar , Jesus nékatsuk yajauch chichakat tusar , aniastaj tusar wearmiayi . Ni chichakmarijiai uuntnum suruktai tusar Túrawarmiayi .

text: And they asked him , saying , Master , we know that thou sayest and teachest rightly , neither acceptest thou the person of any , but teachest the way of God truly :
text2: Tu Enentáimsar Tíarmiayi " Uuntá , ame tuke nekas chicham chichaame , nu nékaji . Aents Pátatek iiyatsme , antsu nekas Yusa jinti jintintiame .

text: Is it lawful for us to give tribute unto Caesar , or no ?
text2: Wats turuttia , ṡRúmanmaya uunt akupin ii kuitri akiktin pénkerkait ? ṡAkiktinkiait ? ṡSuritkiatniukait ? Nu nekaatai tusar wakeraji " tiarmiayi .

text: But he perceived their craftiness , and said unto them , Why tempt ye me ?
text2: Tura Jesuska ni yajauch Enentáimsamurin Nekáa chicharainiak ,

text: Shew me a penny . Whose image and superscription hath it ? They answered and said , Caesar ' s .
text2: " Kuit itiatarum . ṡYana yapi tura yana naari jui aarmait ? " Tímiayi . Tutai nii tiarmiayi " uunt akupniunu . "

text: And he said unto them , Render therefore unto Caesar the things which be Caesar ' s , and unto God the things which be God ' s .
text2: Tutai Jesus Tímiayi " uunt akupniunu átinia nu uunt akupin susatarum . Tura Yusna átinia nu , Yus susatarum . "

text: And they could not take hold of his words before the people : and they marvelled at his answer , and held their peace .
text2: Aents ántamunam ni chichakmarijiai achiktinian penké tujinkiarmiayi . Antsu aya iimprarmiayi tura takamtak pujusarmiayi .

text: Then came to him certain of the Sadducees , which deny that there is any resurrection ; and they asked him ,
text2: Nuyá Satuséu " jakamunmaya penké nantakchamniaiti " tuinia nu , Jesusan aniastai tusar tariarmiayi .

text: Saying , Master , Moses wrote unto us , If any man ' s brother die , having a wife , and he die without children , that his brother should take his wife , and raise up seed unto his brother .
text2: Aniiniak tiarmiayi " Uuntá , Muisáis juna aartampramiaji : " Aishman ni Nuarí Júreatsain jakamtainkia ni yachi nu wajen Nuátkatí , yachin yajutmatratsa . " Tu aarmaiti , tiarmiayi .

text: There were therefore seven brethren : and the first took a wife , and died without children .
text2: Wats , siati yachi ármai , tiarmiayi . Iwiairi nuwan nuatak yajutmatsuk jakamai .

text: And the second took her to wife , and he died childless .
text2: Ni yachi wajen akintiak , Nuátak , niisha yajutmatsuk jakamai .

text: And the third took her ; and in like manner the seven also : and they left no children , and died .
text2: Nuna yachisha Núnisan nu wajen Nuátkamai ; tura Núnisan Ashí siati nuna pataink ~ i Nuátkarmai . Yajutmatsuk yajutmatsuk kajinkiarmai .

text: Last of all the woman died also .
text2: Tura ukunam nuwasha jakamai .

text: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife of them is she ? for seven had her to wife .
text2: Nantaktin tsawantai , nantakiarmatai , ṡyana nuarin ati ? Ashí siati Nuátkacharmaka " tiarmiayi .

text: And Jesus answering said unto them , The children of this world marry , and are given in marriage :
text2: Tutai Jesus Tímiayi " Ju nunkanman nuatnaikiatin awai .

text: But they which shall be accounted worthy to obtain that world , and the resurrection from the dead , neither marry , nor are given in marriage :
text2: Tura nantakiar atak iwiaaku ámin ainia nuka nuatnaikiachartatui .

text: Neither can they die any more : for they are equal unto the angels ; and are the children of God , being the children of the resurrection .
text2: Warí , Jákashtin ainiatsuk . Nayaimpinmaya suntara aintsan ajasartatui . Tura nantakiaru ásar Yusa uchiri ajasartatui .

text: Now that the dead are raised , even Moses shewed at the bush , when he calleth the Lord the God of Abraham , and the God of Isaac , and the God of Jacob .
text2: Tura Jákaru nantakiartin ainia nuna imia Muisáis Jintíamiayi . Warí , numichiniam ji Wajái keamunan Yus niijiai chichaamun , Yus - Papinium Muisaiska aarmiayi . Nú aarmanum Uunt Yus Apraáma , Isaka tura Jakupu Yúsrinti , Tímiayi . Nú aishman yaunchu Jákaru ain " ni Yúsrinti " Tímiayi . Nuna taku nantaktin awai tu Jintíamiayi .

text: For he is not a God of the dead , but of the living : for all live unto him .
text2: Kame jaka menkakatniunam pujuinia nuna Yúsrinchuiti . Tuma asamtai Jakáa Yúsrinti Tíchamniaiti . Antsu iwiaaku ainia nuna Yúsrinti . Ashi Niiniun iwiaarkainiawai " Tímiayi .

text: Then certain of the scribes answering said , Master , thou hast well said .
text2: Nuna antukar Israer - shuara jintinniuri " pénker tame , Uuntá " tiarmiayi .

text: And after that they durst not ask him any question at all .
text2: Tura Nuyánka aniastinian arantukarmiayi .

text: And he said unto them , How say they that Christ is David ' s son ?
text2: Nuyá Jesus Tímiayi " Yus anaikiamu Kristu tutaisha , ṡitiura " Aya Tawit weeaiti " Tárum ?

text: And David himself saith in the book of Psalms , The LORD said unto my Lord , Sit thou on my right hand ,
text2: Warí , Sarmu papinium Tawit ninki juna Tátsuk : " Uunt winia Uuntrun " Akupin pujutainium Winia untsuuruini Pujustá , Tímiayi .

text: Till I make thine enemies thy footstool .
text2: Ame nemasrumin Núpeteatsain nui Pujustá " Tímiayi . " Tú aarmaiti .

text: David therefore calleth him Lord , how is he then his son ?
text2: Kame Tawitkia , Krístun chicharuk , " winia Uuntur " taisha , ṡitiurak Kristu tutai Tawitia Pampanmarí átin ~ ki ? " Tú Tímiayi Jesus .

text: Then in the audience of all the people he said unto his disciples ,
text2: Ashí aents Niin anturkatasa pujuiniai ni unuiniamurin Jesus juna Tímiayi :

text: Beware of the scribes , which desire to walk in long robes , and love greetings in the markets , and the highest seats in the synagogues , and the chief rooms at feasts ;
text2: " Israer - shuaran jintintin ainia Nuyá aneartarum . Niisha esaram pushin entsarar wekasataitsar wakeruiniawai . Tura Jintiá ti shiir áujtusarat tusar wakeruiniawai ; tura iruntai jeanam penkeri pujutainium pujustinian wakeruiniawai . Tura nampernumsha uunt pujutainium pujustaj tusa wakeruiniawai .

text: Which devour widows ' houses , and for a shew make long prayers : the same shall receive greater damnation .
text2: Túrasha wajé jeencha atantainiawai . Túrawar aents nekaracharat tusar ti esaram chichamjai Yúsan áujainiawai . Nincha Chíkichjai nankaamas Yus Asutiáwartatui . "

text: And he looked up , and saw the rich men casting their gifts into the treasury .
text2: Yusa Uunt Jeen Kuítrintin kuit enketainiam Kuítian enkeenan Jesus Wáinkiamiayi .

text: And he saw also a certain poor widow casting in thither two mites .
text2: Tura waje Kuítrincha Jimiará uchich Kuítian , reara aaniun , enkean Wáinkiamiayi .

text: And he said , Of a truth I say unto you , that this poor widow hath cast in more than they all :
text2: Wáiniak Tímiayi " Nekas Tájarme , ju waje Kuítrinchaitiat , Ashí enkeena Nú nankaamas Núkap enkeayi .

text: For all these have of their abundance cast in unto the offerings of God : but she of her penury hath cast in all the living that she had .
text2: Warí , chikichcha ampirma nuna enkeenawai . Tura niisha aya Núchiniak takurmakman ampirmatsuk Ashí enkeayi . "

text: And as some spake of the temple , how it was adorned with goodly stones and gifts , he said ,
text2: Yusa Uunt Jeen kaya Shíirmach armia nuna tura Chíkich Shíirmach susamu armia nunasha Chíkich shuar áujmatuk pujuarmiayi . Nuyá Jesus Tímiayi :

text: As for these things which ye behold , the days will come , in the which there shall not be left one stone upon another , that shall not be thrown down .
text2: " Atum Yamái shiir Wáintrumna nu Ashí emesnartatui . Kaya ekentramusha mash yumpuuntrartatui " Tímiayi .

text: And they asked him , saying , Master , but when shall these things be ? and what sign will there be when these things shall come to pass ?
text2: Nuyá Jesusan chicharainiak " Uuntá , nusha ṡurutaik Túrunat ~ i ? ṡKame ju Túrunatin jeatemamtaisha warijiain nekaattaj ~ i ? " tiarmiayi .

text: And he said , Take heed that ye be not deceived : for many shall come in my name , saying , I am Christ ; and the time draweth near : go ye not therefore after them .
text2: Tutai Jesus Tímiayi " Aneartarum ; anannawairap . Nekaatarum . Winia Náarun pachisar , " wi Krístuitjai " tau ti Untsurí Jíintrartatui . " Nunka amuukatin jeayi " tu etserkartatui . Tuíniakui anturkarum nemariirap .

text: But when ye shall hear of wars and commotions , be not terrified : for these things must first come to pass ; but the end is not by and by .
text2: Tura meset chichamsha , Kapitián mesetan Nájanmasha antukrum sapijmiakairap . Nusha emka Túrunatniuiti . Túrasha Nú chichamaik amuukatin tsawant jeashtatui . '

text: Then said he unto them , Nation shall rise against nation , and kingdom against kingdom :
text2: Nuyá tuke chicharuk Tímiayi ` Shuar Chíkich nunkanmaya shuarjai mesetnum ti nekas maaniawartatui .

text: And great earthquakes shall be in divers places , and famines , and pestilences ; and fearful sights and great signs shall there be from heaven .
text2: Ti uurkattawai ; Untsurí nunkanam tsukasha , sunkursha ti átatui . Nayaimpinmasha ti ashammai Nánkamas Túrunattawai . Nujai Yus ni kakarmarin iniakmastatui . '

text: But before all these , they shall lay their hands on you , and persecute you , delivering you up to the synagogues , and into prisons , being brought before kings and rulers for my name ' s sake .
text2: ` Tura ju Túruntsain atumin pataaturmakar achirmakartatui . Iruntai jeanmasha makurmartai tusar juramkiartatui . Sepunmasha enketmattarme . Tura winia naar Páchia asakrumin , akupniunmasha , uuntnumsha juramkiartatui .

text: And it shall turn to you for a testimony .
text2: Nuinkia atumin Túrutmakrumin wi Túramu etserkatin arutmattarme .

text: For I will give you a mouth and wisdom , which all your adversaries shall not be able to gainsay nor resist .
text2: Tura atumi nemasri nakitramainiak " Wáitiaiti " titinian tujinkiarat tusan , winia nekatairjai chichastinian amastatjarme . Tuma asamtai " Jurakuisha warinia tiniak Kíishtumaktaj tusan aetak Enentáimsashtatjai " titiarum . '

text: And ye shall be betrayed both by parents , and brethren , and kinsfolks , and friends ; and some of you shall they cause to be put to death .
text2: ` Tura imia Atumí aparisha surutmakartatui . Atumí yachisha , Atumí shuarisha amikrumsha Núnisaran surutmakartatui . Tura Máamunka Máawartatui .

text: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name ' s sake .
text2: Tura Winia ajasaru asakrumin Ashí aents nakitramprartatui .

text: But there shall not an hair of your head perish .
text2: Tura penké ishichkisha yajauch awajtamsachartatui .

text: In your patience possess ye your souls .
text2: Katsuntrarmeka iwiaaku átin Wáinkiattarme . '

text: And when ye shall see Jerusalem compassed with armies , then know that the desolation thereof is nigh .
text2: ` Ju pepru Jerusarénka aa tanishriin suntar téntakar matsatu Wáinkiurmeka , emesratin Jeá nekaattarme .

text: Then let them which are in Judaea flee to the mountains ; and let them which are in the midst of it depart out ; and let not them that are in the countries enter thereinto .
text2: Nuikia jui Jutía nunkanam pujuinia nu , Náinnium pisartin ainiawai ; tura jui Jerusarénnum pujuinia nusha juyanka jiinki wétin ainiawai . Tura ajanam pujuinia nusha , péprunam waketkishtin ainiawai .

text: For these be the days of vengeance , that all things which are written may be fulfilled .
text2: Nu tsawantincha Yus Asutiámun Wáinkiartatui . Yús - Papinium nu Túrunatin yaunchu aarma nu uminkiattawai nu tsawantin .

text: But woe unto them that are with child , and to them that give suck , in those days ! for there shall be great distress in the land , and wrath upon this people .
text2: Nunkanam ti Wáitsatin átatui . Tura ju aents ti asutniawartatui . Tuma asamtai nuwa ajamtin ainia nusha , tura uchi Kuírchin takakainia nusha Imiá itiurchatan Wáinkiartatui .

text: And they shall fall by the edge of the sword , and shall be led away captive into all nations : and Jerusalem shall be trodden down of the Gentiles , until the times of the Gentiles be fulfilled .
text2: Tura Juyá aents mesetnum Jákartatui . Tura chikichnaka Ashí nunkanam misaawar Júkiartatui ; tura yajaya apach , Yúsnan Enentáimtuiniatsna nu , jui Jerusarénnum wayawar najakartatui . Nu Túratniunka Yus tsankatkana nuin Túrawartatui . '

text: And there shall be signs in the sun , and in the moon , and in the stars ; and upon the earth distress of nations , with perplexity ; the sea and the waves roaring ;
text2: ` Nuinkia etsanmasha , nantunmasha , Yáanmasha Yuska ni kakarmarin iniakmak Nusháa Túrattawai . Nunkanmasha Ashí aents Páchim Enentáimprartatui . Tura nayaantsanam Chíchimi ti aku Tantáa ajakui ti ashamkartatui .

text: Men ' s hearts failing them for fear , and for looking after those things which are coming on the earth : for the powers of heaven shall be shaken .
text2: Tura Túrunatin ana nuna Enentáimsar Mayái ashinkiartatui . Warí , nayaimpiniam kakaram ainia nusha peantrartatui .

text: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in a cloud with power and great glory .
text2: Nuyá Winia , Aents Ajasu tutain , yuranminiam ti shiir ajasan winiai Wáitkiartatui .

text: And when these things begin to come to pass , then look up , and lift up your heads ; for your redemption draweth nigh .
text2: Nu Túrunatin Nánkamkui uwempratin jeatemayi tusarum kakaarum shiir Enentáimsatarum . '

text: And he spake to them a parable ; Behold the fig tree , and all the trees ;
text2: Tura ju chichamnasha nekapmamiayi . ` Ikiu numi tura Nánkamas numisha Enentáimsatarum .

text: When they now shoot forth , ye see and know of your own selves that summer is now nigh at hand .
text2: Ju nunkanam ni nuké yama punkakmatai " esat jeatemayi " Tátsurmek .

text: So likewise ye , when ye see these things come to pass , know ye that the kingdom of God is nigh at hand .
text2: Núnisan Wi Tájana nu Wáinkiurmeka , Wi ju nunkanam akupin ajastin jeatema nu nekaatarum . '

text: Verily I say unto you , This generation shall not pass away , till all be fulfilled .
text2: ` Tura aents Yamaí pujuinia nu Jáatsain nusha Ashí Túrunattawai . Núnaka paant Tájarme .

text: Heaven and earth shall pass away : but my words shall not pass away .
text2: Nayaimpisha nunkasha amuukartatui . Tura winia chichampruka amuukachminiaiti .

text: For as a snare shall it come on all them that dwell on the face of the whole earth .
text2: Nu tsawant aya aneachma jeattawai . Ashí aents ju nunkanam pujuinia nu , nuna Enentáimtsuk pujuiniai jeattawai . Tuma asamtai atumsha anearum wekasatarum . Yajauchiniam emetnarum , aya Yurumátniuk , aya umartiniak Enentáimtusrum , ju nunkanam ana nu ti wakerakrumninkia pénker Enentáimsatin tujinkiattarme . Nu Atsutí tusarum tura nu tsawant aya áwaktamkaij tusarum pénker wekasatarum .

text: Watch ye therefore , and pray always , that ye may be accounted worthy to escape all these things that shall come to pass , and to stand before the Son of man .
text2: Anearum wekasatarum . Túrunattana nui katsuntrataj tusarum Yus aujsa pujustarum . Túrarum Aents Ajasu tutai iimmianum pénker átaj tusarum Túratarum . "

text: And in the day time he was teaching in the temple ; and at night he went out , and abode in the mount that is called the mount of Olives .
text2: Tuke tsawant tsawaisha Yusa Uunt Jeen Jesus unuiniamiayi . Tura Káshikia Uriwiu Náinnium we - wémiayi .

text: And all the people came early in the morning to him in the temple , for to hear him .
text2: Tura tuke tsawant Yusa Uunt Jeen Jesus chichaamun anturkatai tusar Káshik tariarmiayi .

text: Now the feast of unleavened bread drew nigh , which is called the Passover .
text2: Wakaprutai enketaachma tanta yuatin Námper , paskua tutai , jeatemamiayi .

text: And the chief priests and scribes sought how they might kill him ; for they feared the people .
text2: Israer - shuara Pátririsha Israer - shuara jintinniurisha aentsun ashamainia ásar , itiurak Máawaintiaj ~ i tusar ti Enentáimsarmiayi .

text: Then entered Satan into Judas surnamed Iscariot , being of the number of the twelve .
text2: Nuinkia Iskariúti Jútasan Enentáin íwianch Wáintiamiayi . Nú Jútaska Jesusa unuiniamuriin Páchitkiauyayi .

text: And he went his way , and communed with the chief priests and captains , how he might betray him unto them .
text2: Israer - patri uuntrin tura Yusa Uunt Jee Kapitián pujuarmia nuna werimiayi . Tura Jesusan tu surukminiaiti tusa niijiai chichasarmiayi .

text: And they were glad , and covenanted to give him money .
text2: Niisha nuna antukar warasar " kuit amastatji " Jútasan tiarmiayi .

text: And he promised , and sought opportunity to betray him unto them in the absence of the multitude .
text2: Niisha " ayu " tinia , aents nékachmanum suruktaj tu Enentáimsamiayi .

text: Then came the day of unleavened bread , when the passover must be killed .
text2: Wats , wakaprutai enketaachma tanta Yúatin Námper jeamiayi . Paskua tutainium murikchin Máatin ármiayi .

text: And he sent Peter and John , saying , Go and prepare us the passover , that we may eat .
